Azat sells his agricultural production (milk, meat, honey, fruits and vegetables) in Sevan city’s food markets.  Azat’s wife helps him in farming and animal breeding. Azat says that without his family members help, he couldn't overcome all the difficulties in the agricultural business.

With the profit from his agricultural business, Azat meets his family's needs. For about 2 years, Azat has accumulated the profit from his tractor services.
He dreams to buy a new tractor because his tractor is too old and worn. For the purchase of a new tractor, Azat needs a loan amount 1,000,000 Armenian dram.

loans.use: to buy a new tractor

loans.name: Artem

texts.en:
Artem is a 23-year-old young farmer. He lives with his parents and brother in Tsaghkunk village, which is in the Sevan area.  Artem’s father is a tractor driver and mechanization specialist, and from childhood Artem loved and has been engaged in agricultural techniques. Often he helps his father in this occupation.

Artem’s family is engaged in farming and animal breeding. They have 6 cows, more than 25 sheep and 3 calves. Artem transports meat and dairy production from animal breeding to Yerevan and sells in the food markets. In the garden near their house, Artem grows vegetables and fruits.   Artem and his family members work hard throughout the day to take care of all the family's needs. He says that agricultural business is very hard but very profitable. 

Artem needs a loan to buy new equipment which produces bales of hay, which will help his family to organize rural work more efficient. Artem decided to provide paid services with his new equipment to his villagers. Artem hopes to receive more profit from his lovely occupation and to collect money for his wedding in the future.

loans.use: to buy new equipment which produces bales of hay

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is taking a loan of $600.  She is married and she has four children to improve her business. She is running a business that helps her to generate income for her family.

She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as cement, sand and iron. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $200. Rosita is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future. Her husband is a teacher.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and iron

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing and sneakers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install a gate.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir is continuing with his shoe production and trading business. His business is going well and after Kiva loans he enlarged his production. He confessed that he is not a superstitious person, but after Kiva lenders helped, his income was increased.
 
One of his sons has left Armenia for Russia to work abroad. The other of his twin sons helps Vladimir to sell shoes, which they produce in their house. He sells shoes in his rented stall in Yerevan’s clothes market.

Vladimir has a large number of orders for women's shoes and for this he needs a loan of 1,100,000 Armenian dram (AMD) to buy colored leather and other raw materials to produce his summer season women shoes collection. He hopes to make the order in time with Kiva lenders' help. This loan will help Vladimir to earn a good profit.

loans.use: To buy colored leather and other raw materials for his shoe production and trading

loans.name: Abdias

texts.en:
Abdias is 59 years old and married with one child. He earns a living by farming sugarcane and rice in the Philippines. Abdias has been farming sugarcane and rice for 20 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

Abdias is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. He is working tirelessly toward the attainment of his dream: to build and expand his business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 57 years old and married with four children. She lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She sells flowers in the local community to earn a living. She has been in this business for over eight years and earns 8,000 PHP every month. 

Zenaida joined in GDMPC in 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. In the future, she wants to make improvements of her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
A citizen from Kampong Cham province, Oun, 39, is married and has three children. To cover the expenses of her family’s daily food consumption, she sells homemade rice wine, raises pigs, and works at a construction site. To better feed the family, her husband also works for others for a fee for extra income. Oun has been involved in her current business for 20 years. 

This is not Oun's first loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past two loans have not only improved her business but also supported her living status in a good manner. Now, Oun is applying for a loan of 3,100,000 KHR. She will buy fertilizer, rice seed, pig feed, and pay for plowing. She hopes that she can earn more income from her business and keep her children in school until tertiary school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed, pig feed, and to pay for plowing

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Zhora

texts.en:
Zhora is a hairdresser with a good reputation in Vanadzor city. He has been engaged in this occupation for more than seven years. Zhora rents a place in one of Vanadzor’s beauty salons and carries out his work. For two years he worked in the Russian Federation, but he decided return to his motherland and work in his lovely city. 

Zhora is married and lives with his wife and two children in Vanadzor city. He is the only bread winner in his family and he works throughout the day to meet his young family's needs. 

Zhora is asking Kiva lenders for a 300,000 Armenian dram (AMD) loan to buy a new barber chair and hairdressing tools in order to provide high quality services to his customers.

loans.use: To buy a new barber chair and hairdressing tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a room for her business.

loans.name: Homer

texts.en:
Homer. a 47-year-old married father of four, lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, where he has been planting and harvesting vegetables for sale to earn a living for over six years. He earns 5,000 PHP every month.

Homer joined GDMPC in 2010 and has now requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. In the future, he wants to improve his house and the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: San Pedro De Katañiray Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SAN PEDRO DE KATAÑIRAY”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Julia  ella es casada tiene 10  hijos  y tiene 50 años de edad; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de ganadería, la socia elabora yogurt, queso con la leche que producen sus vacas para luego vender a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva años con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia. 
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de una vaca lechera.
Los otros socios  se dedican a la venta de verduras, a la agricultura, brindando servicio de taxi, ganadería, crianza de animales menores.
EL socio que sale en la foto adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: The San Pedro de Katañiray village bank is located in the town of Anta in the Cusco province of the department of Cusco. Julia is married and has 10 children. She is 50 years old. She alternates her daily duties with her livestock business. She makes yogurt and cheese with the milk her cows produce and then sells it to her customers. She has had this business for several years, and it is going well thanks to the hard work she puts into it every day. She is a responsible person with a lot of initiative, which is how she helps her family have a better life. She is requesting this loan so she can buy a dairy cow. The other members sell produce, grow crops, offer taxi services, raise livestock, and raise small barnyard animals. The member pictured in the smaller photograph requested permission to arrive at the meeting late because of his work responsibilities. Julia is grateful to everyone who has been part of this dream and is committed to making her payments on time and in full.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Gerrin

texts.en:
Gerrin, 49 years old and married, earns a living by selling seedling trees in the Philippines. In business for 15 years, she also earns income from food vending.

Gerrin is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to purchase plastic bags, fertilizers and other equipment for her business. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase plastic bags, fertilizers and other equipment for her business.

loans.name: El Triunfo Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal El triunfo está conformado por 8 integrantes, siete mujeres y un hombre, todas madres y padres de familia con hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Ello son originarios del  Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. se caracteriza por ser trabajadores, responsables con ganas de superación personal, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron estudiar, y se vieron obligados a trabajar desde temprana edad. 

Gracias  a su espíritu y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora del banco es Graciela y tiene por actividad económica la venta de pan, de forma ambulante, con un canasto sobre su cabeza de unos 20 kg. El objetivo del crédito es surtir de pan para la venta como cachos, semitas, tortas, pasteles, dedos, enrollados, picos. El banco comunal EL Triunfo agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: The El Triunfo village bank has eight members: seven women and one man. All of them are parents with children in their care. They are from Sauce, in the north of the country. They are hardworking and responsible people who strive to better themselves. Unfortunately, their lack of financial resources prevented them from studying, and they have had to work from a young age. Thanks to their spirit and their desire to live a better life, the bank's leader is Graciela, who sells bread door to door carrying a twenty-kilogram basket on her head. This loan will supply baked goods for her to sell, including cakes, pastries, rolls, and other treats. El Triunfo is grateful for the help that Kiva's lenders offer people with few resources and poor countries like Nicaragua so they can have a dignified way of earning a living.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and supply her business selling bread, cakes, pastries, rolls, and other treats.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a machine for cutting wood.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Four years ago, Alex decided to start his own business as a welder. With over 21 years of experience, Alex made the decision to expand his customer base and take his business to the next level. Alex has made a significant investment in his business from both a financial and managerial standpoint and has his welding expertise down to an art. But, Alex wants to begin working on his business rather than just in it.

Since the beginning of the year, Alex has enrolled in numerous business courses and workshops around San Antonio. He attends many seminars a week to learn everything from marketing to contracting. It was at these community resource partner meetings that Alex learned about ACCION Texas Inc.

With the ACCION’s help, Alex’s plans include executing new marketing strategies and acquiring new customers. With the loan he received from ACCION, Alex will be able to purchase a new trailer for his equipment, complete advertising displays, build a website and purchase the insurance and software required to bid on larger projects.

Alex is a frequent attendee at ACCION’s business education seminars and has been taking training courses in QuickBooks. Alex understands this loan is a great step towards building his credit and growing his small business.

loans.use: to purchase a new trailer for his equipment, complete advertising displays, build a website and purchase the insurance and software required to bid on larger projects.

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es: doña blanca de 40 años de edad vive con sus dos hijos de 19 y 16 años de edad viven en casa propia, se dedica a vender todo tipo de ropa de forma ambulante con las ganancias que obtiene logra cubrir algunos de los gastos de su hogar, Doña Blanca solicita un credito que le permita comprar mas mercaderia como: faldas, blusas, ropa interior para damas, caballeros y niños, panatalones entre otras cosas y asi surtir su negocio para tener mejores ganancias y poderle dar a sus hijos todo lo que necesitan sin limitacion alguna.
texts.en:
Doña Blanca is 40 years old and lives in her own home with her two children, ages 19 and 16. She sells all types of clothing as a street vendor. With the profit she earns, she is able to cover some of her household expenses.

Doña Blanca is requesting a loan so that she can buy more merchandise such as skirts, blouses, undergarments (for women, men, and children), trousers, and other items. This will enable her to restock her business so that she can earn more income and provide everything her children need without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy skirts, blouses, undergarments, trousers, and other items.

loans.name: Caminantes Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CAMINANTES”  iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Ignacia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de frutas, venta de detergentes, venta de edredones, tejido de chompas y mantas, venta de verduras, venta de carne de cordero, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Ignacia es integrante, ella indica que hace siete años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una asesora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; mismo que inicia al observar la necesidad de sus vecinos y de ella misma que existía en la zona.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de azúcar, arroz, fideo) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito y el ahorro.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Caminantes” (Travelers) is starting its seventh loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani Community Center. This group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Ignacia as its president. The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses such as selling fruit, selling detergents, selling bedspreads, weaving sweaters and blankets, selling vegetables, selling beef, and selling food.

This loan will benefit small businesswomen such as Sra. Ignacia. She says that she joined Pro Mujer seven years ago after receiving an invitation from an adviser from the organization who came to visit her at her house. Ignacia currently manages a neighborhood store. She started this business because she saw there was a need among her neighbors, as well as her own needs, that existed in the area.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying sugar, rice, and noodles. She acquires her goods at the fairs in the city of El Alto and then sells them from her retail space. Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her household. Ignacia is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Ignacia said that she enjoys the loans and the savings.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and noodles.

loans.name: Mi Dios Es Mi Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mi Dios es Mi Fortaleza está conformado por 10 integrantes, nueve mujeres y un hombre, padres y madres responsables con 20 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Ellos son originarios del  Malpaisillo lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. Estas personas se caracterizan por ser responsables, trabajadoras, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente son personas de escasos recursos la cual se vieron obligadas a trabajar desde temprana edad. 
La coordinadora del banco comunal es  Matilde y tiene por actividad económica la venta de cuajada, de forma ambulante y en su casa de habitación. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de cuajada para ofrecer a sus clientes. La rutina de trabajo de Matilde es de unas 8 horas diaria, con una pana sobre su cabeza ofreciendo su cuajada. El banco comunal Mi Dios es mi Fortaleza agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener  un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The communal bank Mi Dios es Mi Fortaleza [My God is My Strength] comprises 10 members: nine women and one man. They are all responsible parents who, between them, have 20 children in their care. They are from Malpaisillo, in the north of the region. The members of the group are characterised by responsible and hardworking outlook, and their desire to do well personally. Unfortunately they have few resources, which has meant they have all had to work from a young age. 

The coordinator of the communal bank is Matilde. Her economic activity is the sale of curds on a mobile basis and from her home. Her objective for getting the loan is to invest it in working capital and to stock her business, which involves buying and selling curds, in order to supply her customers. 

As part of her work routine, Matilde works 8 hours a day, with a basket on her head, selling her curds. The communal bank Mi Dios es mi Fortaleza is grateful to the Kiva investors for the assistance they give to people with scarce resources and in poor counties like Nicaragua so that they may have a means to obtaining a decent job.

loans.use: to invest in working capital for the buying and selling of curds for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy glass display cases, stuffed animals, sales slips, and other items to set up her store

loans.name: Leidy Yuliana

texts.es:
Leidy es una joven de 21 años de edad, hace seis meses terminó un curso de confección y hoy desea iniciar con la creación de su negocio. Le sobran ganas de salir adelante y convertirse en microempresaria pero no cuenta con los recursos para la compra de los implementos necesarios para el desarrollo de la actividad, razón por la cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de una máquina fileteadora industrial.
Su mayor deseo es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y brindarles estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Leidy is a young woman who is 21 years old. Six months ago, she completed a sewing course and now she wants to start her own business. She has a great desire to move forward and become a micro-businesswomen, but she doesn't have the resources to buy what she needs for this activity. This is why she is applying for a loan that she will use to buy an industrial overlock sewing machine. Her greatest wish is to improve her family's quality of life and give them economic stability.

loans.use: to buy an industrial overlock sewing machine.

loans.name: Gloria Patricia

texts.es:
Gloria de 44 años de edad, se dedica desde hace algunos años a laborar en cafeterías y panaderías. Por lo cual hace un año tomó la decisión de crear su propio negocio, allí comercializa principalmente bebidas, mecatos y licor. 
Hace algunos meses sufrió un accidente en donde se fracturó una pierna, situación que la obligó a ausentare de su labor. 
Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de un televisor y compra de surtido con el fin de aumentar su  clientela y las ventas. Espera mejorar su condición económica y posicionar su negocio dentro del mercado local.
texts.en: Gloria, 44, has worked in cafeterias and bakeries for many years. So a year ago, she decided to start her own business. She mainly sells drinks, snacks, and liquor. A few months ago, she had an accident and fractured her leg, which caused her to miss work. Now she is asking for a loan to buy a television and buy supplies in order to increase her clientele and sales. She hopes to improve her economic situation and position her business within the local market.

loans.use: to buy a television and supplies (snacks and liquor)

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marrieta works hard to support her family. Marrieta is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Marrieta requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like soap, canned goods, sugar, spices, etc.

Marrieta has been in this business for 19 years now, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

In the future, Marrieta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like soap, canned goods, sugar, spices, etc.

loans.name: Hoy's Group

texts.en: A 53-year-old widowed mother of nine children, Hoy is a local rice farmer from Kampong Cham province. She has a one-hectare area for growing her rice, an activity in which she as been engaged for a long time and now is able to earn up to 37,200 KHR per day. This is the first micro loan for Hoy’s group consisting of three female members with VisionFund(Kiva's partner) and they are seeking for the same loan amount, 1,000,000 KHR each. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to pay for plowing fees and to buy rice seed for her farmland. She hopes to support her business on time and get a good income for her family’s sake.

loans.use: To pay plowing fees and to buy rice seed for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José Antonio de 27 años de edad, soltero, originario de Managua, lugar que está ubicado en la ciudad de  zona central de la región. Él se caracteriza por ser una persona, trabajadora, responsable con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, por falta de recursos económicos. Pero le hubiera gustado estudiar contaduría pública

Gracia a su espíritu y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de ropa variada como pantalones, short, camisas, faldas, vestidos, camisetas, ropa interior. Negocio que lo tiene ubicado en unos de los mercado de la localidad, el dedica una 10 horas diaria a su actividad, actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de ropa variada. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  José Antonio agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno
texts.en:
Jose Antonio, 27, is single and is a native of Managua.  He lives in a city in the central part of the region.  He is known for being a hardworking and responsible person who has a strong desire to achieve personal success.  Unfortunately, he was not able to enroll in a university due to a lack of financial resources.  However, he would have liked to have studied public accounting.

Thanks to his spirit and his desire to get ahead, he has a business selling a variety of clothing such as: pants, shorts, shirts, skirts, dresses, T-shirts, and underwear.  His business is located in one of the markets in the area.  He devotes 10 hours a day to his business, and he performs this work with pleasure.  His goal with this loan is to invest in working capital, stocking his business by purchasing a variety of clothing to sell.  This way, in the near future, he will be able to earn more income.  Jose Antonio thanks the Kiva lenders for the help that they are providing to people of limited resources in poor countries like Nicaragua, so that they can have a way to work with dignity.

loans.use: to buy pants, shorts, shirts, skirts, dresses, T-shirts, and underwear.

loans.name: Marvelous

texts.en: Marvelous is 28 years old, married with one child. She lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates planting and harvesting rice for sale in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 3 years and earns 8,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in the year 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer,such as manure. In the future, she wants to make improvements on her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, such as manure.

loans.name: Met's Group

texts.en: A local villager from Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district, Met is 42 years old and married. She has four children in total, only two of whom are dependents. Besides rice farming, which she and her husband work on together as the primary source of income, she also runs a small grocery stall for extra income. After 22 years of involvement in her current business, she is able to earn up to 19,000 KHR per day. Met, a four-time borrower with VisionFund(Kiva's partner), has completely repaid back the past loans with success to upgrade her lifestyle in a good condition. She is a leader of a  micro group loan composed of four female members - two, including her, are second-time borrowers, whereas the remaining two are the borrowers for the fourth time. The total amount of her entire group loan is 4,400,000 KHR. Met, whose loan portion is 1,400,000 KHR, will use her loan to plow her farmland and buy more grocery items for restock. She hopes that this loan will support her business on time and return her a good profit.

loans.use: to plow her farmland and buy more grocery items.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Net's Group

texts.en: Net, 42, is a mother of three kids and is originally from Tbaung Khmum district, Kampong Cham province. She has managed one and half hectares of land with her husband for cropping rice and works for others for a fee for extra income. Her 22 year engagement in the current business now yields a return of about 20,000 KHR per day. From this decent income, she is able to save up to 5,000 KHR per day after offsetting the necessary expenses. This is the third loan for Net with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan with success and it supported her businesses right away. In this cycle, she has formed a group of two to apply for a new loan. She is seeking for 1,400,000 KHR while her co-borrower is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to fix her house. She hopes that this loan will mend her house on time so she does not need to worry about the upcoming rainy season.

loans.use: to fix her house.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Maria Vicenta

texts.es: María, tiene 36 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su conyugue, tiene 4 hijos y vive en una aldea del municipio de Choloma, Cortes. María, tiene 6 años de haber establecido su propio negocio de pulpería, donde vende variedad de productos de la canasta básica familiar como ser, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, pan, churros, refrescos, dulces, manteca, pastas, papel, jabón etc. Ha decidido solicitar un segundo préstamo a ODEF por 20,000 Lempiras para surtir el negocio e incrementar las ventas  y los ingresos. Comprara azúcar, arroz, frijoles, churros, refrescos, manteca, pan, huevos, etc. Su plan es crecer con el negocio para tener una mejor vida con su familia.
texts.en:
María is 36 years old and in a common-law relationship with her husband. They have four children and live in a neighborhood in the town of Choloma, Cortes.

Six years ago, María established her own grocery business where she sells a variety of household products such as rice, beans, sugar, bread, chips, soft drinks, sweets, lard, pasta, paper, soap, and other items. She decided to request her second loan from ODEF in the amount of 20,000 HNL so that she can restock her business, as well as increase her sales and her income. María will buy sugar, rice, beans, chips, soft drinks, lard, bread, eggs, and other products. Her plan is to grow her business so that she can have a better life with her family.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, beans, chips, soft drinks, lard, bread, eggs, and other products.

loans.name: Voeun's Group

texts.en:
Voeun is a father of two schoolchildren. He is a peasant from Kampong Cham province, where rubber trees are a famous product. He has managed a rice cropping and rubber tree planting business as his primary source of income for 17 years. 

In this business, he is able to earn up to 30,000 KHR daily. Voeun has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before, and neither have his co-borrowers. In the group of three, he is a leader. 

Voeun and his co-borrowers are seeking loans of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the group leader, he will use his loan to buy fertilizer for his farmland. He hopes that he can gain triple the yield and make a good profit.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Patlynde

texts.en:
Patlynde is 54 years old and married, and has one child who attends school. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Patlynde runs a general store in the Philippines, and has been in this business for six years. She has requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy stocks of items to sell like spices, shampoo,  canned goods, and noodles.

In the future, Patlynde would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of items to sell like spices, shampoo, canned goods,  and noodles

loans.name: Sophat's Group

texts.en:
Sophat, age 49, is a widow from the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. 

With two hectares of rice cultivation and one hectare of pineapple farming, she is able to earn up to 19,700 KHR daily. She has been in this business for 10 years. 

Her first loan with VisionFund (Kiva's partner) was four cycles ago. She has fully has repaid back her first loan, as well as her consecutive three loans, with success. The past loans have improved her livelihood and helped meet her family's needs. 

Now, she is a leader in a group of two members. She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 KHR, the same amount as her fellow group member. Sophat will use her portion of the loan to buy potash and insecticide, and to pay for the labor cost for her cash crop. She hopes that these purchases will help her to better support her business and provide for her family.

loans.use: To buy potash and insecticide, and to pay for the labor costs for her cash crop

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.en:
Magdalina is 50 years old, married, and has six children. She lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. 

Magdalina owns and operates a food vending business to earn a living. She has been in this business for over 8 years, and earns 8,000 PHP each month. She joined GDMPC in 2008, and is now requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional food to sell. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her home and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional food to sell

loans.name: Lucía Guillermina

texts.es:
Lucía Guillermina es una profesora de 51 años que ha ejercido su profesión por más de 30 años, digna de admiración por haber enseñado a miles de estudiantes sauceños a leer y escribir y que hoy son grandes profesionales que ayudan al desarrollo de Nicaragua.

Es madre de tres niños en edad escolar a los cuales les ha brindado una vida digna llena de amor y bienestar bajo sus posibilidades con el humilde salario de maestra. Con la ayuda de los préstamos construyó su propia casa y la que ha ido mejorando poco a poco con el paso de los años.

Agradece a Kiva y Ceprodel porque han apoyado y aportado su granito de arena a esta familia necesitada.
En la actualidad está solicitando un préstamo para mejorar la tapia del patio de su casa la cual está en mal estado y necesita darle mayor seguridad a su familia. 

Con el cual adquirirá ladrillos, cemento, arena, hierro y pago de mano de obra.
Espera y confía en Dios que su solicitud sea aprobada para poder llevar a cabo su inversión.
texts.en:
Lucía Guillermina is 51 years old and a teacher who has been in the field for more than 30 years.  She is very admired for having taught thousands of Saucan (from the City of Sauce) students to read and write and who have become great professionals and helped develop Nicaragua.

She is the mother of three school-aged children to whom she has provided a dignified life full of love and wellbeing with her humble teacher’s salary.  With the help of loans she was able to build a home of her own and she has been improving it little by little over the years.

She is grateful to Kiva and Ceprodel because they have supported and provided a little grain of sand to this family in need.

She is asking for a loan in order to improve her patio cover, which is in bad shape and she needs to provide better security for her family.

She will use the money to buy bricks, cement, sand, iron bars, and pay for labor.  She trusts in God that her request will be approved and she will be able to make this investment.

loans.use: to fix her patio roof.

loans.name: Nazgul

texts.ru:
Назгул 41 год, воспитывает дочь. Назгул работает в преподавателем в школе  и  в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав 19 лет назад с суммы (KGS) 6,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Назгул в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  2 головы крупного рогатого скота с приплодом, 13 головы мелкого скота, доход от продажи молока составляет около 8,000 сом.   
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Назгул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)  на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки дойной коровы.  Доходы от кредита Назгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и мечтает купить автомобиль.
texts.en:
Nazgul is 41 years old and is bringing up a daughter. Nazgul works as a schoolteacher and, as an additional source of income for her family, also raises livestock, having launched this business 19 years ago with a starting capital of 6,000 KGS. Thanks to Nazgul’s hard work, her farm now includes two heads of cattle with their young and 13 heads of small livestock; her revenues from milk sales are about 8,000 KGS.

In order to develop her business further, Nazgul applied to the “Bai Tushum & Partners” microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 50,000 KGS intended for adding a dairy cow to her livestock. Nazgul plans to invest the resulting revenues into a further growth of her business; her dream is to buy a car. 
.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Lon

texts.en:
Lon is 62 years old and a citizen from Battambang province. To meet the daily costs of living, he performs rice farming on 10 hectares with the support of his wife. He has been in this business for 17 years. 

He is a seven-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and has fully paid back his previous loans. Managing his rice farming business, he was able to buy a mini-tractor to support his farmland. For this loan cycle, he is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 KHR in order to buy gasoline for his tractor in order to plow his farm. He will also use the loan to purchase potash to boost his crop's productivity. 

He hopes that he can make more income from his business in the future, thus improving his lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy gasoline for his tractor in order to plow his farm, and to purchase potash

loans.name: Jeny Zorayda

texts.es:
Jeny Zorayda de 48 años de edad, casada con dos hijos de 21, 15 años los cuales están estudiando. Es originaria de Managua, lugar que está ubicado en la zona central de la región. Ella se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de salir adelante. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar mucho con su familia tiempo de calidad. Le prepara comida típica de la región como es “gallo pinto” lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar enfermería profesional.

Gracias a su espíritu y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de medicamentos  éticos,  genéricos de diferentes casas comerciales como alka D, panadol, losartan, gavapentina, tramadol, gavileb, tenolol, diasepan, ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diaria, actividad que la disfruta mucho. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en uno de los mercados de la localidad. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir  su negocio en la compra y venta de medicamente ético y genéricos. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Jeny Zorayda agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Jeny Zorayda is 48 years old, married, and has two children, 15 and 21 years old, who study at school.  She is originally from Managua, located in the central part of the region.  She is known to be a hardworking and responsible woman who wants to succeed.  In her free time, she likes to spend quality time with her family.  She prepares traditional local dishes such as gallo pinto (rice and beans).  Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources, she was not able to attend university, but she would have liked to study for a professional degree in nursing.

Thanks to her spirit and desire to succeed, she works selling generic prescription medicines from different commercial brands such as alka D, panadol, losartan, gavapentina, tramadol, gavileb, tenolol, and diasepan.  She works about 10 hours every day and she enjoys her work a lot.  Her business is located in one of the markets in her town.  She is requesting this loan to invest in working capital and stock her store with prescription and generic medicines to sell so that in the near future, she can earn more income.

Jeny Zorayda is grateful to the help Kiva lenders provide to people with limited resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua so that they can have a decent working environment.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her store by purchasing generic prescription medicines.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: La señora Betty tiene 39 años de edad, casada, tiene dos hijos que dependen de ella, uno de ellos es el que le ayuda en las actividades agropecuarias y al mismo tiempo está estudiando en el colegio cursando el nivel secundario y su otro hijo se encuentra estudiando en la escuela. Actualmente se dedica a la siembra de maíz, cría y venta ganado bovino y maní colorado. El diario vivir de doña Betty es muy sacrificado y agotador ya que son varias actividades que tiene que atender.  Los ingresos que obtiene no son suficientes para cubrir los gastos de la alimentación, salud, estudios de sus hijos y por ende de su familia, por ese motivo ella tomo la decisión de solicitar un crédito Kiva para  la refacción de galpón p/cría de pollos. Ella con esta actividad tiene la esperanza de aumentar sus ingresos, por lo consiguiente podrá mejorar su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Betty is 39 years old. She is married and has two children who are dependent on her. One of the children helps her with her agricultural activities, while also studying at second level. Her other child is at primary school. 
At present she works sowing maize, as well as rearing and selling cattle, and growing red peanuts. Betty’s daily life is marked by sacrifice and exhausting work as she has many activities to attend to. 
Her income is not enough to cover her bills for food, health or the education of her children, and therefore it is not enough for her family’s expenses. For this reason, she has decided to request a Kiva loan to replace a henhouse where she rears chickens. She is hoping to increase the income she earns from this activity, and thereby improve her and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to replace a henhouse for rearing chickens

loans.name: Ishkhan

texts.en:
Ishkhan is 36 years old. He lives with his wife and child in their own house in Vanadzor city.  After school and military service, Ishkhan used to be a worker in Vanadzor. 

About six years ago, Ishkhan became engaged in shoes trading. He rents a stall in Vanadzor’s clothes markets and sells men's shoes. Ishkhan buys the merchandise from Yerevan wholesale markets and shoe manufacturing shops. He is the only bread winner in his family. His wife takes care of their little child and does not work outside the home. Ishkhan says that to find a good job in Vanadzor is too hard and he is happy that he is able to take care of his family's needs with his trading help.

Ishkhan is asking Kiva lenders for a loan to buy a new summer shoe collection from Yerevan for resale in his stall. He hopes to earn a good profit and to save some money for his little child’s future.

loans.use: To buy a large amount of summer shoes for men from Yerevan

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a married mother of three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 47 years old and one of her children is in school.

Teresita has a native mats making business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. Teresita has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to purchase additional materials for making mats. In the future, she would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for making mats

loans.name: Romualda

texts.en:
Romualda is 60 years old and married with seven children. With one child currently in school, Romualda works very hard to provide for her family.

Romualda runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, sugar, shampoo, biscuits, snack foods, etc. Romualda requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of items such as coffee, sugar, shampoo, biscuits, snack foods to sell in her store. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of items such as coffee, sugar, shampoo, biscuits, and snack foods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Moy

texts.en:
Originally from Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district, Moy is a 28-year-old father of two dependent children. He struggles to earn a living through raising pigs, growing rice on a half-hectare of land, and growing cassava on one hectare of land. Moy has been in this business since he was 20 years old. 

Moy's previous loan was his first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and he has fully repaid it. The past loan supported his income-generating activities seasonably to pay for a transplanting fee for his rice crop and weeding for his cassava plantation. Now, he is seeking a loan of 4,000,000 KHR. He will use this loan to buy pig feed and to pay for weeding and plowing. He hopes that this loan will help him fatten his pig to a healthy condition and support his farm on time for replanting season. This will enable him to triple his income to sustain his living.

loans.use: To pay a weeding fee, a plowing fee,and to buy pig feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilisers, pesticides and to pay for labour

loans.name: Hing's Group

texts.en:
A young mother of two children, Hing is a 24-year-old local farmer residing in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. Hing grows cassava on one hectare and rice on one-half a hectare of land. In business for five years, she is able to earn 40,000 KHR per day.

Hing, a second-time borrower, joins with a third-time borrower in this group of two to request a loan from Kiva partner VisionFund. Having repaid her first loan, she is seeking 2,500,000 KHR, while her fellow member is requesting 1,500,000 KHR. As the group leader, Hing will use her loan to pay for plowing fees, fertilizer and insecticide. She will also spend a portion of it to buy grocery items for resale for extra income.

Hing hopes to increase her profit to improve her family's living standard.

loans.use: To pay for plowing fees, fertilizer and insecticide.

loans.name: Ferney Andrés

texts.es:
Las necesidades del hogar, se han convertido para Andrés, un joven de 23 años de edad, en su mayor prioridad. Asegura que el bienestar de su familia es su mayor preocupación y su responsabilidad debido a que es el hombre mayor de la casa. Desde que terminó sus estudios de bachillerato, ingresó al mundo laboral y gracias al desarrollo de sus actividades genera el sustento para su familia. 
Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la adquisición de su propio negocio, una sala de internet, en donde además se ofrecerán servicios de mantenimiento de equipos y reparación de celulares. 
Andrés asegura que con la compra del negocio las condiciones económicas de su familia mejorarán considerablemente y el podrá tener la oportunidad de ingresar a la universidad para realizar una ingeniería en sistemas.
texts.en:
The necessity of maintaining a household has become the major priority for Andres, a young man of 23. Assuring the wellbeing of his family is his major preoccupation and responsibility, since he is the senior man of the house. After finishing his upper secondary education, he entered the working world and thanks to the development of his activities, he has generated the necessary support for his family.

Today, he is soliciting a loan to invest in the acquisition of his own business, an internet cafe where he will offer added services such as computer equipment maintenance and cell phone repair. 

Andres is confident that with the purchase of this business, the economic conditions of his family will improve considerably and he will have the opportunity to enroll in the university to become a systems engineer.

loans.use: buy the computer components necessary to create an internet cafe.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: A 32-year-old woman, Daisy is married to Resty. She lives in the village of Bayabo, province of Isabela. She is a very hardworking person and patient in whatever she is doing. To earn additional income she is asking for a loan of Php 8,000. She will use it to buy feed and additional piglets for her business. She dreams that her business may expand, so that she may meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and additional piglets for her business

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita works hard to support her family. She is married, and she has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years.

Anita requested a PHP 29,500 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.  She will use it to buy additional box of fish to resell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional box of fish to resell

loans.name: Hak

texts.en: Originally from Kampong Cham province, Hak is married and blessed with seven children. Currently, her main source of income comes from farming one hectare of land in rice and raising eight pigs. She earns about 39,600 KHR per day. Hak has never had a loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. She is seeking a 2,000,000 KHR loan in order to buy potash, rice seed, and pig feed. She hopes these purchases will support her business on time with a good profit.

loans.use: To buy potash, rice seed, and pig feed

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Thang

texts.en:
Thang is a 36-year-old mother of three kids, who are still in school. She is a villager from Dambae district, Kampong Cham province. She struggles to make a living, by growing soy beans and cassava. She has been with this business for 16 years.

Thang is on her third loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her previous loan with success, and has grown her business in a good shape. Now, she is asking for a 4,000,000 KHR loan.  She will use it in order to buy seed and fertilizer, and to pay plowing and reaping fees. She hopes that this loan will help her to be ready for the replanting season on time, and get back a high yield from the crops, to better her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy seed and fertilizer, and to pay plowing and reaping fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy liquor.

loans.name: María Nora

texts.es:
María de 61 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora y con grandes sueños por realizar. Toda su vida ha laborado vendiendo comidas, pero debido a una enfermedad debió suspender la actividad. Hoy después de algunos meses decidió retomar su oficio, razón por la cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de un carro de comidas rápidas. 
Espera poder generar los recursos necesarios para seguir pagando su vivienda y cubrir las necesidades del hogar.
texts.en:
María, age 61, is an enterprising woman with big dreams to fulfill.

She has worked all of her life selling food.  However,  she had to suspend her business activity due to an illness.

Now, after a few months, she has decided to take up her trade once again.  That is the reason she is requesting a loan.  She will use the loan to buy a fast food cart.

She hopes to be able to generate the resources needed to continue paying for her house and to cover the household necessities.

loans.use: to buy a fast food cart.

loans.name: Sameur's Group

texts.en: A local villager living in Dambae province of Kampong Cham province, Sameur is married and 44 years old. She has seven children, but only two children are under her dependency as they are still in school. She deals with the daily cost of living via farming cassava and rice. She has been farming for 20 years and is able to earn up to 38,000 KHR per day. This is the second loan for Sameur with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has completely repaid her past loan, which she used to support her business. Now, the total amount of her group loan is 9,000,000 KHR. Sameur, the group leader, has a loan portion of 1,200,000 KHR. She will spend her portion of the loan to plow her farmland and to buy potash and insecticide for her farmland. She hopes that she can gain a high yield from her current business and maintain a good living condition for her family.

loans.use: To plow her farmland and to buy potash and insecticide

loans.name: Martha Ceciclia

texts.es:
Martha tiene 44 años de edad y es madre cabeza de familia de cuatro hijos. 
Por su condición de madre soltera le ha tocado esforzarse y luchar por sacar su familia adelante. Desde hace seis años se dedica a laborar en restaurantes y panaderías por lo cual aprendió sobre el oficio y desde hace dos años tomó la determinación de independizarse y dedicarse a la venta de comidas rápidas.
Gracias a esta labor Martha les ha brindado a sus hijos una vivienda digna y educación. Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de insumos para la preparación de alimentos. 
Su mayor anhelo es mejorar la condición económica en su hogar y garantizarles a sus hijos mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Martha, age 44, is a mother and head of her family of four children.  Due to her situation as a single mother, it has fallen to her to put forth great effort and struggle to get her family ahead.

She worked in a restaurant and bakery for six years.  She learned about this trade, and two years ago she made the decision to become independent and sell fast food.

Thanks to this work, Martha has given her children a decent home and education.

She is now requesting a loan to buy ingredients to prepare the food.

Her biggest goal is to improve the financial condition of her household and to ensure that her children have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food.

loans.name: Somean's Group

texts.en: A mother of four children who are students in a local primary school, Somean is 43 years old. She is a farmer who grows rice and vegetables. Having been in her current business for 25 years, she earns up to 23,000 KHR per day. This is not the first loan for Somean with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She repaid her past loan wisely, and it enabled her to upgrade her living status. For now, she is taking out a loan with her co-borrower in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. Somean will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her income and make a good living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is 58 years old and single, and she works very hard to provide for her parents. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 12 years. 

She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase items to stock her store, like shampoo, soap, coffee, and milk. In the future, Valentina would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase items to stock her store, like shampoo, soap, coffee, and milk

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar is a 53-year-old, athletic lady. She lives with her husband and son, in Vanadzor city.
 
Gohar graduated from State Institute of Physical Culture of Armenia. From 1976 until now, Gohar has worked in a Vanadzor sport school as a coach. In 2002, she was awarded the title of Honored Coach of Armenia. In 2012, the European Association of Athletics awarded her the Best Women's Coach of the Year. Gohar’s students are the winners of many competitions, in Armenia and in other countries.
 
Gohar needs a loan to buy a new computer and printer. These items will help her to organize her training plans. They will also help her to obtain more information, by Internet, about upcoming athletic competitions in the world.

loans.use: To buy a new computer and printer, for her work as a coach of high-level athletes

loans.name: Byambatogtokh

texts.en:
Mr. Byambatogtokh, 30 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering taxi service to local people for four consecutive years and accumulated experiences such as where, how and when to pick up customers and how to drive them fast to their destination. Before his taxi service, he has been working as a cook at a restaurant. His wife prepares some food at home and sells it to vendors at an outdoor market. Their children all go to secondary school. 

Mr. Byambatogtokh is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase furnishings and appliances such as a television, fridge, television shelf and kitchen implements. These items will make the house a more comfortable place and he will work more enthusiastically, taking encouragement from his improved living conditions. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase furnishings and appliances such as a television, fridge, television shelf and kitchen implements

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia works hard to support her family. Virginia is married and has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines.

Virginia requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell. She has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Virginia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Merenesa

texts.en:
Merenesa is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Merenesa is 39 years old and has four children who are in school.

Merenesa has a food vending business in the Philippines. Merenesa requested a PHP 12500 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

Merenesa has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Merenesa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en: Pov, age 51 and an inhabitant of Pursat Province, is 51 years old and a widow. She has five children, only one of whom is still in school. For her, rice farming and pig-raising are the primary sources of income. She is able to earn up to 15,200 KHR from the current business that she has had for 16 years. She has been engaged with the current business for the past two cycles. She has repaid back her past loans with good progress, and she has supported her business on time. Moreover, she is able to set aside some money to buy grocery items for resale for extra income. Now, she is seeking 400,000 KHR while her joint members are applying for 600,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy more piglets to raise and pig feed. She hopes to raise healthy pigs, so she can make more profit.

loans.use: To buy more piglets to raise and pig feed

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Sopheap, who lives in Pursat province, is 34 years old. She is married and a mother of three little kids. She does rice farming on two hectares of land, as the main source of family income. For extra income, her husband works for others for a fee in addition. Having been involved in the current business for ages, she is able to earn up to 24,400 KHR per day.

Sopheap has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for two loan cycles, including this loan. She managed to repay her past loan with success, and it has upgraded her business in a gradual manner. Now, she is seeking to borrow 2,000,000 KHR. She will use it in order to smooth her farmland for replanting season. She hopes that she can grow her rice on time and make a good profit, for her kids' sake.

loans.use: To smooth her farmland for replanting season

loans.name: Soeurn

texts.en: Soeurn, 58, is married and has eight children. Currently, only one child is still in school. Soeurn mainly depends on a single agricultural business, rice farming on three hectares, which she has been involved in for 30 years. She is able to generate about 28,000 KHR per day. Soeurn has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for a long time and has fully repaid back her past loan. The past loan has helped her to relieve her family’s burden and to earn a decent income to finish up her house construction on time. Now she is seeking 2,000,000 KHR to buy 9 sacks of potash and to pay the reaping and plowing fees for her farmland. She hopes that she can increase the yield from her crops and make a good profit.

loans.use: To buy 9 sacks of potash (fertilizer for rice crops) and to pay the reaping and plowing fees

loans.name: Arsen

texts.en:
Young police officer Arsen was born in 1983. He lives with his wife, newborn son and parents in Ijevan city. 

After serving in the military, Arsen now works in the Ijevan Police Agency of Armenia.  Concurrently, Arsen is studying at the Ijevan branch of the State Armenian University in the Department of Psychology and Pedagogy.

Arsen needs a loan for amount 200,000 Armenian drams to pay for his education.

loans.use: To pay for his education

loans.name: Chek's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Battambang province where rice farming is the common business among the villager, Chek is 26 years old and a young mother of two little kids. Not different from her neighbors, she also does rice farming as the main source of income on seven hectares of land. For six years with her current business, she is able to earn up to 22,700 KHR per day. 

Chek has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. She joins a group of two to apply for a new loan. She is the group leader, and she will spend her loan portion to buy potash, seed, and to pay for plowing and reaping expenses. She hopes to gain a high yield and make triple the income for her family.

loans.use: To buy potash, seed, and to pay for plowing and reaping

loans.name: Darlene Rose

texts.en:
Darlene Rose is a 31-year-old married woman and a mother of four young children from Tagbilaran, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fish vending business for more than nine years now. Her husband is a construction worker. 

Darlene Rose is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell in the market. Through this loan, she will be able to improve her business and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in the market

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is 52 years old, married with seven children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a fish vending business to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 10 years and earns  2,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in the year 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional fishing materials. In the future, she wants to make improvements on her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing materials

loans.name: Sokvy

texts.en: Age 37 and a peasant from Kandal Stoeung District of Kandal Province, Sokvy is a mother of five children. Four of her children are still in school. To deal with daily living expenses, she does rice cultivation while her husband works at a construction site for extra income. This is the second loan for Sokvy with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is able to maintain a standard of living for her family. Now, she is seeking 1,200,000 KHR. She will use her loan to buy a plot of farmland for growing more rice. She hopes that she can gain a high crop output so that she can improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland for growing more rice

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: Sim, orginally from Moung Russey district of Battambang province, is married and blessed with six children. Currently only three kids are under her dependency as they are still in school. To sustain the family, she grows rice, pineapples, and corn. Her farming activities are the main source of her family’s income. She has been involved in her current business for 16 years. Her previous loan was her first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan, which enabled her to upgrade her lifestyle. Now, she is seeking a 2,500,000 KHR loan in order to prepare her farmland for her crops. She hopes to grow her crops on time and receive a high yield.

loans.use: To prepare her farmland

loans.name: Huoch's Group

texts.en:
A mother of three from Battambang province, Huoch is 32 years old and a local farmer in the area. Huoch's primary income-generating business is rice growing on four hectares, while her secondary business in selling grocery items on a small scale. Her 10 years in rice growing have enabled her to earn up to 31,000 KHR per day.

Having repaid her previous loan, Huoch is requesting her second loan from Kiva partner VisionFund as the leader of a group of four. She will use her loan portion to buy potash and insecticide for her farmland, purchases she hopes will result in a good crop yield.

loans.use: To buy potash and insecticide for her farmland

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en:
A local citizen from Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, Sreymom is a 33-year-old mother of two little kids. Currently, she works at a local factory, while her husband transports water for sale in the village. The current business has returned her about USD 3.60 per day. She saves from this income about USD 2.50 per day after offsetting the necessary expenses. 

Sreymom has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for three times (loan cycles), including this loan. She has wisely used her loan to relieve her family’s burden and improve its livelihood. For this cycle, she is applying for 1,000,000 KHR in order to buy a decent motorbike to support her husband’s business, as his old motorbike is broken already. 

Sreymom hopes that this loan will help her to buy a new motorbike on time, so that her husband can continue his job and get more extra income for the family’s sake.

loans.use: to buy a  decent motorbike to support her husband's business.

loans.name: Vasil

texts.en:
Vasil is 41 years old. He lives with his wife, daughter, son and pensioner parents in Ijevan city. Vasil has a higher education; he is an engineer. Vasil has worked in his profession many years but after the Soviet Union dissolution he became jobless. 

Since 2006 Vasil has run his own transportation business. Vasil bought a mini bus and started to transport pupils and students in his car. He organizes various trips primarily for students and pupils. Vasil's wife helps him to meet the needs of their big family; she works in Ijevan University as a secretary assistant. 

Vasil’s car is a little bit old and needs some repairs. As he confessed, it is very important to have a car in perfect condition in his occupation. 

Vasil asks Kiva lenders for a loan to repair his car and to buy new tires for the summer season.

loans.use: To repair his car and to buy new tires for the summer season

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Van, 52 and a mother of two children, is a farmer from Thmor Kol district of Battambang, where her residential area is. Paddy rice-cropping, which she has been doing for 25 years, is the only source of the family’s income.

Three cycles ago was Van’s first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan has supported her crop at a good pace with a good yield in return; she has completely repaid her past loan, too. 

Now, her requested loan amount is 3,600,000 KHR. She will use this loan to buy rice seed, potash, and gasoline to pump water for the farm. She hopes to earn more income so she can upgrade her living condition into a prosperous condition.

loans.use: to buy rice seed, potash, and gasoline to pump water for the farm.

loans.name: Cheour's Group

texts.en:
A 55-year-old widowed mother of nine children, Chhoeur is a cultivator who does rice-cropping and cassava farming. She has been with the current business for 20 years, earning about 33,000 KHR per day.

 This is not the first loan for Chhoeur with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  After the successful past seven loans that she has repaid completely, she feels confident that she can better support her business in a timely manner. 

For this cycle, Choeur leads a group of four to apply for a new loan. The total amount of her group loan is 4,800,000 KHR. Chhoeur, as the group leader and whose loan portion is 1,000,000 KHR, will spend her loan portion to plow her cassava farm. 

She highly hopes that she can earn more income from her cash-crop so that she can set aside some money for future needs.

loans.use: to pay for the plowing fee for her cassava.

loans.name: Bunsat's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Bunsat is 44 years old and married. She is blessed with three children. Bunsat, with support from her husband, depends solely on rice-growing on a seven-hectare area. She has been involved in this for ten years. 

Bunsat is a fourth-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan, which she has completely repaid, has uplifted her living in a steady manner, especially in providing decent meals three times daily for her kids. 

Now, she is in need of working capital to support her farmland. Hence, she formed a group of three to apply for a new loan. As the leader, Bunsat will spend her loan portion to plow her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice on time and make a good yield and high income.

loans.use: to plow her farmland.

loans.name: Burenbuyn

texts.en:
Mrs. Burenbuyn, 35 years old, lives with her husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. 

Burenbuyn has been working as an accountant at a private business entity since 2006, and is considered to be one of the skilled staff by company managers. Her husband has been rendering taxi services to local people for six years and has accumulated a vast amount of experience in where to pick up customers and how to shorten routes. 

Burenbuyn and her husband began building a house on their land last autumn. They completed the main components of the house, but due to lack of finances, they haven't finished their house. Living in a house is way better than living in a ger for comfort and warmth. During the harsh wintertime, they burn tons of coal in order to heat their Mongolian traditional ger. 

So, Burenbuyn is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials, such as bricks, planks, cement, fiberglass and foam. Using these building materials, she and her husband can finish their house and after that, insulate their house with fiberglass. The resulting high-quality house will enable the family to burn less coal, release less smoke and then contribute to the efforts against air pollution. 

The borrower is a very hardworking individual who doesn't want her husband or son to chill down to their cores during the harsh wintertime.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials.

loans.name: Nan's Group

texts.en:
Age 32 and a farmer from Kampong Cham province, Nan is 32 years old and has three dependent schoolchildren. She and the rest of her family count on agricultural activities: cassava and rice farming. Her 10 year engagement in the current business has returned her about 24,400 KHR per day. 

This is the first microloan for Nan’s group, consisting of two females.  She and her joint member are seeking for 500,000 KHR and 1,000,000 KHR, respectively. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to pay for plowing fees and labor costs, and to buy potash and insecticide. She highly hopes that she can gain a high yield with a good income.

loans.use: To pay plowing fees and labor costs and to buy potash and insecticide

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is married and has five children. She is 58 years old and lives in Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. To earn a living, she owns and operates a retail store, selling grocery products such as noodles, spices, canned goods, laundry and bath soap, and soft drinks. She has run this business for eight years. Each month, she earns PHP 8,000.

She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to acquire additional grocery products to sell. Merlinda joined GDMPC in 2007. She hopes to expand and improve her business, to gain more income for the family and create a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to acquire additional grocery products to sell.

loans.name: Dalin's Group

texts.en:
Dalin is a 40-year-old, married mother of two children. They are dependent on her and still in school. Dalin and her family live in a rural village of the Ratanak Mondul district, Battambang province. She and her husband are nurses, who work in the local area. They have been working in this field for ten years. She and her husband are able to earn about 28,000 KHR per day, to meet the family’s needs.
 
Dalin has been with VisionFund for six loan cycles, and she has completely paid back the past loans. She has successfully used the past loans to better support her family and her children’s education. Now, she is leading her group of four to ask for a new loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy piglets for raising, to earn additional income for her family. She hopes this loan will let her fatten her pigs, so as to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy piglets for raising, to supplement the income she earns working as a nurse

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a computer, a play station, a TV, and stationery products

loans.name: Leoniza

texts.en:
Leoniza is 49 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a retail business to earn a living. She has been in her business for over six years and earns 9,000 PHP every month.

She has been a member of GDMPC since the year 2010. Now, she has requested a loan of 17,500 PHP. She will use the loan to purchase additional products to sell, like noodles, sugar, coffee, soap, shampoo and canned goods. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell, like noodles, sugar, coffee, soap, shampoo and canned goods.

loans.name: Diana Caridad

texts.es:
La señora Diana de 33 años de edad es soltera, vive con su madre y tiene  una hija   que depende de ella, vive en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 10 años  a la venta de ropa nueva.
Doña Diana vende ropa y calzado para todas la edades, su clientela son las maestras, personas que laboran para la portuaria, amigos, familiares y personas que ha diario visitan su negocio.
Doña Diana se caracteriza por su buen trato hacia sus clientes y buena atención a sus clientes, está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de ropa como blusas, pantalones, vestidos, faldas, camisas y calzonetas.
Doña Diana desea en especial comprar ropa para dama  porque se acerca el día de las madres y desea tener surtido para atender a sus clientas es por tal razón que solicita este crédito y así obtener mejores ganancias.
Doña Diana está muy contenta de trabajar con Prisma y su sueño es abrir un nuevo negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Abril del 2013
texts.en:
Diana, 33, is single and lives with her mother.  She has a dependent daughter.  Diana lives in the community of San Lorenzo, a valley in the southern part of Honduras.  She has her own house, and has had a business selling new clothing for 10 years.

Diana sells clothing and shoes for all ages.  Her customers are teachers and people who work for the port, friends, relatives, and other people who visit her store daily.

Diana is known for her good service and good treatment that she provides to her customers.  She is requesting a loan to buy clothing such as: blouses, pants, dresses, skirts, shirts and bathing suits.  

Diana particularly wants to buy women's clothing, because Mother's Day is approaching and she wants to have her store well-stocked for her customers.  This is why she is requesting this loan, which will help her to obtain better earnings.

Diana is very content working with Prisma, and her dream is to open a new business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - April 2013

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants, dresses, skirts, shirts and bathing suits for her business

loans.name: Senkata 2012 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SENKATA 2012”  iniciará el décimo séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Erica es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de deportivos por mayor, venta de productos por catálogos, tienda de barrio, venta de comida, venta de ropa, librería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Erica es integrante, ella indica que hace diez y siete años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de librería; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió con los ahorros que había te nido en Pro Mujer.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cuadernos, estuches geométricos, bolígrafos, etc.) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene una hija.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Senkata 2012” will begin its 17th cycle at Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Senkata. It is made up of 9 members and is headed by a board where Erica is the President. 

The business that the members of the communal bank are in are varied and among them are: wholesale sales of sports items, catalog sales, neighborhood store, food sales, clothing sales, and bookstore.

The loan they are requesting will benefit the small microenterprises where Erica is a member. She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for 17 years, joining through the invitation from a friend who is a member of the institution. Today she has a bookstore; she discloses that she launched this business with the savings she had in her Pro Mujer nest.

The loan that she is asking for is to increase her capital (to buy notebooks, geometry sets, pens, etc.) buying from the wholesalers in the city of La Paz and later selling them in her sales outlet. This way of working allows her to generate resources to maintain her household as much as possible as she lives in a partnership and she has a daughter.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training in health and credit.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, geometry sets, pens, etc.

loans.name: Samith's Group

texts.en:
Samith is 54 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area in the Sangke district of Battambang province.  She has five children. 

Growing rice, oranges and Jackfruit are the main sources of her family’s income to make living.  She has been in this business for 10 years.  With the current business, she can earn approximately 45,000KHR per day and save about 15,000KHR each day for the future needs. 

Her husband works as a motor-taxi driver.  

This is the second micro loan for Samith with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund.  The other member has been with VisionFund for six loan cycles.  Samith completely repaid her loan and is the group leader.

Samith will use her portion to repair an old motorbike for her husband’s business.  She hopes this loan will enable her to repair it so he can provide better service to his customers.

loans.use: to repair an old motorbike for her husband’s business.

loans.name: Saron's Group

texts.en:
