She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her third loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice and flour with packs of oil from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Tasneem

texts.en:
Ms. Tasneem had a difficult time after her husband's business failure. She decided to work with her husband to support her family for a better future. 

Two years ago Tasneem began stitching work in her house. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. 

Therefore, she applied for a loan of Rs. 30,000 from Kashf. She intends to use this loan amount to buy raw material, including cloth, thread in different colors, and packs of laces and zippers. This will create a means for increasing revenues, so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income.

loans.use: to buy raw material including cloth, thread in different colors, and packs of laces and zippers.

loans.name: Saleeman

texts.en:
Ms. Saleeman is a 41-year-old married woman and mother of four children. The man shown in the photo is Saleeman’s husband, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family’s expenses, but now the rickshaw requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Saleeman applied for a loan of Rs 20,000 for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide a better transport service to his passengers. 

Saleeman is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Ms. Sara is a 34-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. The man shown in the photo is Sara’s husband. They have gained two years of experience in this field and are happily working together to meet the household expenditures. Sara is a mother of two children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. 

People of their community prefer to come to their place on daily basis. Sara wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to cater to more customers without fail. Sara hopes to increase her net income and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to cater to more customers without fail.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Ms. Salma is a 54-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. She is motivated to provide all facilities of life to her family. Her husband has been running a general store in his community for the last two years. Salma also helps her husband in business by dealing with customers, as she has good communication skills. 

To meet the demands of her customers, Salma needs to purchase more packs of biscuits, rice and flour. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 20,000. With the help of this loan, she will be able to meet the increasing demands of her clients and to generate more revenue. She wishes to utilize part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of biscuits, rice and flour.

loans.name: Dilia

texts.es:
Doña Dilia es una mujer adulta de 54 años de edad casada, luchadora, emprendedora y con muchas Fuerzas de salir cada día que pasa adelante junto y sus 3 hijos adultos cada uno en hogar. Ella tiene un grado de escolaridad de primaria completo y en su juventud no pudo seguir estudiando ya que los ingresos económicos eran muy pocos y las circunstancias difíciles. Bajo su techo vive uno de sus hijos el cual tiene en compañía a su esposa la cual ayuda con los quehaceres del hogar y otras actividades que a diario se presentan. Fueron sus padres los que a ella le enseñaron el cultivo de café y al cultivo de plátano mismos que hoy en día siguen cultivando y ha sido medio de ingreso para sus padres y hoy en día para su familia. Las tierras que hoy en día cultiva fue una herencia de parte de sus padres y su producto es comercializado con los compradores que llegan a la zona y demás que se dedican a la venta de este producto como lo es el plátano y café.     

Hoy en día ella solicita ayuda para la compra de fertilizantes y abono ya que de esta forma ella podrá asegurar su cosecha y brindar un producto limpio y sano a sus clientes.

Sus metas son de lograr mantener sus cultivos sanos y limpios para que puedan ser cotizados en el mercado por su calidad e higiene y mantener su clientela para algún día poder ampliar sus cultivos y dejarlos como herencia a sus hijos y ellos a sus nietos.
texts.en:
Dilia is a 54-year-old, married woman.  She is an enterprising fighter who works hard every day to get herself and her three adult children, all of whom live at home, ahead.  She completed primary school, but was not able to keep studying because of little income and difficult circumstances.  One of her sons lives under her roof with his wife, who helps with the household chores and other daily tasks that come up.  Her parents are the ones who taught her how to grow coffee and bananas, which they are still growing today, and this has been a source of income for her parents and now for her own family.  She inherited the land she grows on from her parents and she sells her produce to the buyers who come to this and other areas and who specialize in selling produce such as bananas and coffee.

She is currently asking for help to buy fertilizers and manure, as these will ensure a good harvest and afford her customers clean, healthy produce.

Her goals are to be able to keep her crops clean and healthy so they will be valued at market for their quality and hygiene and so she can keep her clientele so that one day she can expand her crops and leave them as an inheritance to her children, who can leave them to her grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and manure for her coffee and banana crops

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 50-year-old married man. He has two children with ages ranging from 12 years to 21 years. He describes himself to be honest. 

Peter operates a retail shop where he sells sugar, salt, flour and other items. He has been involved in this business for twenty years. His business is located in an urban area, and his primary customers are household customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

He will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more sugar, flour, salt and other items for his retail store. His business goal is to open a mini-supermarket within five years. This is his fifth loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loans were paid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, flour, salt and other items for his retail store.

loans.name: Malka

texts.en:
Ms. Malka is a 42-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She deals in the business of milk sales. Over the time, she has become famous in her area for providing good quality milk. She counts a good client list and makes enough to contribute to the family income. 

Malka requested a loan of PKR 25,000 from Kashf Foundation to purchase another milk cow. It would accelerate her sales, and she plans to spend her profits on expanding her business. She is satisfied with the support of Kashf Foundation, saying, “It is owing to Kashf’s help that I was able to overcome my difficulties, otherwise we would have probably starved."

loans.use: to purchase another milk cow.

loans.name: Riaz

texts.en:
Ms. Riaz is a 33-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house for one year. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts for years. 

Riaz is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 to buy packs of grains, sugar and cleaning products to cater to more customers time after time. 

She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of grains, sugar and cleaning products to cater to more customers time after time.

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Ms. Fozia is a 38-year-old married woman and has been running a business of milk sales with her husband for four years. 

She has two buffaloes in milk and sells their milk, along with butter and cheese that she makes from the milk, to many people in her vicinity. She also looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of collecting milk from them, while her husband sells it to different places on a daily basis. They are happily doing this together to support their family. 

Fozia is a mother of four children; three of them are school-going. She needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures, including food, clothing and education. In order to make huge profits, she requested a loan of Rs 20,000 to buy one more buffalo in milk. This will inflate milk sales, which ultimately will help in generating more income.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo in milk.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Ms. Sughran is a 38-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. The man shown in the photo is Sughran's husband. 

Sughran has gained six years of experience in this field. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts for years. 

Sughran is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store. 

She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store.

loans.name: Enrique Jose

texts.es: El señor Enrique José de 46 años de edad, soltero y originario de Chinandega, desde hace siete años surgió la idea de  la compra y venta de chatarra, donde empezó a comprarle a los pobladores de Chinandega, corinto y Chichigalpa, donde él les propone comprar a estas personas todos los materiales de hierro o aluminio que ya no están en uso en el hogar, ya que este material lo reciclan, para la elaboración de un nuevo producto, entregándolo a acopiadores de Chinandega, con mucho sacrificio ha logrado tener su propio medio de transporte, como es una camioneta con perifoneo, para llevar los materiales que las personas les venden. Él está solicitando financiamiento para invertir en capital de trabajo para comprar más chatarras y poder obtener mejores ingresos. El está muy agradecido con los inversionistas Kivas por la ayuda que les brinda a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en: Enrique José is 46 years old, single, and comes from Chinandega.  Seven years ago he got the idea to buy and sell scrap and he started to buy from people in Chinandega, Corinto, and Chichigalpa.  He offers to buy all the iron and aluminum that these people are no longer using at home, as these materials are recycled to make new products, and he turns them over to collectors in Chinandega.  Through a great deal of sacrifice he has been able to get his own means of transportation, a truck with a loudspeaker, to carry the materials people sell him.  He is asking for a loan to invest in working capital to buy more scrap so he can make more profits.  He is very thankful to Kiva's investors for the help they offer low-income people.

loans.use: to have working capital to buy more scrap materials to make more profits

loans.name: Gaudence

texts.en: Gaudence, a 39-year-old married mother of five, is requesting this loan to buy cows and pigs to sell. She wants to shift from selling vegetables to selling animals, with the resulting profits to be put toward savings.

loans.use: To buy cows and pigs to sell.

loans.name: Jaime Anacleto

texts.es:
Condega  un municipio que está ubicado en la parte norte del departamento de Estelí, conocido como tierra de alfareros por su artesanía y gente trabajadora. En una comunidad aledaña conocida como el jocote, Vive el señor Jaime Anacleto, con su esposa y cuatro  hijos al que tiene el deber de mantener y darles sus estudios, de profesión, agricultor, en granos básicos maíz y frijoles  y la ganadería en una pequeña escala.

Conocido como una persona honesta y trabajadora tiene una propiedad de 20 manzanas de extensión con diferentes tipos de aéreas para la explotación agrícola y ganadera.

Recientemente visito a para solicitando un crédito para compra de abono, foliar,  herbicida, fungicida  más gastos en mano de obra, donde piensa salir beneficiado y darle el mantenimiento correspondiente  a sus cultivos maíz y frijoles. 

El lleva 03 créditos para este tipo de actividad, tiene 2 años de trabajar con Ceprodel. El impacto y beneficios que tiene él y su familia son de una forma positiva ya que trabajan  su finca a través de siembras agrícolas en cada ciclo,  mejorando su nivel de vida y condiciones económicas con los ingresos obtenidos en cada cosecha realizada.
texts.en:
Condega is a municipality that is located in the northern part of the Estelí department.  It is known as a land of potters because of its crafts and hardworking people.  Jaime Analeto lives in an outlying area known as El Jocote.  He lives with his wife and four children for whom he has the responsibility to support and provide an education.  

He is a farmer, and he grows basic grains, corn, and beans.  He does raise livestock on a small scale.

He is known as an honest and hard-working person.  He has land that is 20 ‘manzanas’ in size [a manzana is a land measurement unit equivalent to 7000 square meters].  The land has different types of areas for farming and for livestock.

He recently requested a loan to buy manure, foliar fertilizers, herbicide, and fungicides and to pay for labor.  He plans to benefit by giving appropriate maintenance to his corn and bean crops.

He has had three loans for this type of business activity, and he has worked with Ceprodel for two years.  The impact and benefits that he and his family have are positive.  They work on the farm by growing crops in each cycle.  They are improving their standard of living and their financial situation with the income gotten from each completed harvest.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Alitrije

texts.en:
This loan will be Alitrije's first, and she is excited to be part of the Value Chain Projects:

“I was not eligible for a loan due to my poverty level until recently. Now I am ecstatic because I have been given the opportunity through this project to add some goats of a good breed to my existing herd. They will increase milk production; the goats I have at the moment can’t produce much,” said Alitrije.

Alitrije, who has been in the livestock business for several years, lives in a rural area of central Albania with her husband, their two children, and an orphaned niece. She wants to send her niece to university, and she hopes that the increased income from the increased milk production will help her achieve this goal.

Alitrije is grateful to all Kiva lenders for their kind assistance.

loans.use: To buy some goats of a good breed.

loans.name: Juana María

texts.es:
Doña Juana María es originaria del municipio de El Sauce un pequeño poblado ubicado al occidente del departamento de León. 

Estudió la carrera de Educación primaria y actualmente se desempeña como maestra en el colegio de la comarca de Salales ubicado a 20 km de dicho municipio.

Es madre soltera de dos hijos uno de ellos independiente y el otro que estudia la carrera de medicina en Cuba.
 
Uno de sus grandes sueños es ver preparado a su hijo como médico y brindar este servicio en su propio pueblo para ayudar a las personas sobre todo del campo que son de escasos recursos. Con la ayuda de Dios consiguió una beca para que su hijo estudiara fuera del país la carrera que él quería y como ella no tenía recursos para que él estudiara en Nicaragua prefirió mandarlo a Cuba con gran sacrificio y además no ver a su hijo por muchos años pero con la ilusión que llegará a ser un gran médico.

En este momento está solicitando un crédito en Ceprodel para pagar algunos gastos de la universidad de su hijo y espera que los inversionistas de Kiva a través de Ceprodel le apoyen con su solicitud donde les quedará eternamente agradecida.
texts.en:
Juana María comes from the municipality of El Sauce, a small town located in the western part of the department of León.

She has a degree in primary education and she currently teaches at the local grammar school in Salales, 20km from her municipality.

She is the single mother of two children, one of whom is independent while the other is studying medicine in Cuba.

One of her biggest dreams is to see her son become a doctor and offer his services in their own town to help low-income people and especially people living in the country.  With God's help her son got a scholarship to pursue the degree he wanted outside the country, and because she did not have the money to send him to school in Nicaragua, she chose to make the huge sacrifice of sending him to Cuba and not seeing him for many years in the hope that he will become a great doctor.

She is currently asking Ceprodel for a loan to cover some of her son's university expenses and she hopes that Kiva's investors will support her through Ceprodel, for which she will be eternally thankful.

loans.use: to pay for her son's university studies

loans.name: Helyn Mayela

texts.es:
La joven Heylin Mayela es una maestra que reside en la ciudad de Condega, un pequeño pueblo ubicado a unos 35 km al norte de la cabecera departamental Estelí. Esta joven esta felizmente casada y tiene dos hijos en educación primaria, a los que junto con su esposo costean los gastos escolares. Residen en su casa propia desde hace más de cinco años.

Esta joven trabaja a diario como maestra de lunes a viernes por la mañana en una comunidad cercana a la ciudad de Condega donde ella viaja todos los días para impartir sus clases y por la tarde ella regresa a su casa a planear sus próxima clase, de esta manera ella labora para tener sus ingreso que le sustenta los gastos familiares.

Esta joven maestra se presento a las oficinas de Ceprodel por primera vez a solicitar un financiamiento para poder construir sus servicio higiénico y su dicha en su casa de habitación que ha ido construyendo con esfuerzo propio. Ella solicita este crédito ya que sus ingresos familiares mensuales no son lo suficiente como para asumir por su propia cuenta los gastos que implica la construcción de dichos servicio, por lo que ella pide se sea aprobado este crédito y lograr mejorar su casa de habitación y agradece de antemano le sea aprobado el crédito ya que quiere mejorar las condiciones de su casa y por ende darle un mejor nivel de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The young Heylin Mayela is a teacher that lives in the city of Condega, a small town located about 35 km north of the head department Estelí. This young woman is happily married and has two children in their primary education, which creates school expenses for her and her husband. They have lived in their own house for more than 5 years.

This young woman works daily as a teacher from Monday to Friday in the morning in a community center in the city of Condega where she travels every day to give her classes and in the afternoon she returns home to plan her next class. In this way, she works to have income to sustain the family expenses.

This young teacher presented herself at the offices of Ceprodel for the first time to request a loan to be able to build toilet facilities in her home that has been built by their own efforts. She is requesting this loan because her monthly family income is not sufficient to be able to on her own assume the expenses for the construction of said services. For this reason she asks to be approved for this loan to be able to improve her home. She give thanks in advance for this loan because she wants to improve the condition of her house and therefore give herself and her children a better life.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as cement, bricks, etc, and to pay for labor for the plumbing.

loans.name: Mario Jose

texts.es: Mario, 47 años de edad, habitante de la ciudad de Granada, padre de 7 hijos. El se dedica a la elaboración de mosquiteros de forma artesanal. Negocio que inicio hace 10 años pues su esposa y su suegra se dedican a elaborar lo mismo y de ellas aprendió este oficio. Anteriormente trabajaba vendiendo monturas para caballos y zapatos. Pero decidió apoyar a su esposa y se dedicó a trabajar por completo junto con ella y sus hijos pues se ha convertido en un negocio familiar, ellos viajan a los diferentes departamentos fuera de la ciudad en busca de nuevos clientes y dar a conocer más su producto. Él está solicitando el crédito para comprar tela al por mayor. De esta manera espera conseguir mejor precio para adquirir la materia prima y producir más. En lo futuro desea trabajar con máquinas eléctricas para darle un mejor acabado a sus mosquiteros.
texts.en:
Mario, 47, is a resident of the city of Granada, and is the father of 7 children.  He has a business making hand-made bed nets.  He started this business 10 years ago, as his wife and mother-in-law also are in this line of work, and he learned this trade from them.  He previously worked selling shoes and saddles for horses.  But he decided to support his wife and start working with her full-time, and with their children they have made this into a family business.  They travel to the different departments (regions) outside their city, looking for new customers and getting people acquainted with their products.  

Mario is requesting a loan to buy fabric at wholesale.  In this way, he hopes to get his raw materials at a better price so that he can produce more.  In the future, he wants to work with electric machines to put a better finish on his bed nets.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Rosa Adriana

texts.es:
Rosa, de oficio  comerciante, es dueña de una pulpería. Fue beneficiada con su primer crédito el cual le permitió surtir un poco más su pulpería compro productos  que antes no vendía por falta de capital, se siente agradecida por el apoyo brindado. Esto la motivo aún más a seguir invirtiendo para logra alcanza su anhelado sueño el cual es tener una distribuidora. 
Está solicitando este financiamiento  para comprar galletas, jugos, leche, crema, mantequilla, enlatados, jabones, detergentes, sodas y granos básicos. Pues son parte de los productos que diariamente le solicita su clientela.
texts.en:
Rosa is a shopkeeper who owns her own grocery store. She was offered her first loan which allowed her to stock her store a little better and purchase products she was not previously able to sell due to a lack of capital. She is grateful for the assistance she has been offered. This motivates her to continue investing in her shop to achieve her desired dream of having a distributor. 

She is requesting this loan in order to purchase cookies, juices, milk, cream, butter, canned goods, soaps, detergents, sodas, and staple grains. These make up part of the products that her customers request daily.

loans.use: purchase cookies, juices, milk, cream, butter, canned goods, soaps, detergents, sodas, and staple grains.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 30 years old. She sells different items in her boutique. She has requested a loan to buy more items to resell, such as sugar, sodas and rice. The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house. She is very thankful with the previous loan, which helped her to upgrade her business.

loans.use: To purchase more sugar, sodas and rice for sale.

loans.name: Sughra

texts.en:
Ms Sughra is a 52-year-old, married woman. Ten years ago, she started her own business of clothing sales, when her husband became severely ill. She didn’t lose hope, and she contacted Kashf Foundation, upon the advice of her neighbor, to expand her own business. She buys clothes of different designs from a market, in bulk, at lower rates, and resells them in her community at a profit. She counts a good customer list. Most her customers are her neighbors.

Sughra is the mother of two children. They are going to college. She wishes to send her children to colleges with high reputations, but she is unable to cover the expenses. She has gradually improved her business, and now she has requested a loan of Rs. 25,000. She is going to use this loan to buy an ample variety of clothes, in a larger quantity, to add to her current ones. She intends to use the earned profits on her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy an ample variety of clothes, in a larger quantity, to add to her current inventory

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Ms Asia is a 52-year-old, married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store for the past two years. She is expert in dealing with customers and makes enough income to bear the everyday expenses of the family.  She is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide her family with good-quality food, clothing and health care.

To make her store fully stocked, she needs to purchase a stock of rice, sugar and grains. For this reason she applied for a loan of Rs. 40,000 from Kashf Foundation. She is in her sixth loan cycle and has a good repayment history.  She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of rice, sugar and grains.

loans.name: José Leonel

texts.es:
Achuapa un bello y encantado Municipio ubicado en el departamento de León, donde existen muchas personas con deseo de superación. 

José Leonel se llama el Joven de 44 años edad Luchador por su vida y la de su familia, brinda su servicio en uno de los centro. 

Vive con su esposa y tres hijos bajo su cargo, ella trabaja como Maestra de educación primaria, con lo poco que gana ayuda a su esposo en el sustento diario de su hogar.
Son de sus sueños mejorar su vivienda, por tal razón solicita a Kiva Y Ceprodel que le financie un crédito para la compra de: Cemento, Arena, hierro con esto ayudaría mucho a su familia en poder mejorar su viviendita. 

Agradece a Dios por haber encontrado a kiva y Ceprodel y tener la oportunidad de solicitar su quinto crédito, ya que su vivienda la ha ido obteniendo a través de crédito con Kiva Y Ceprodel, por eso solicita nuevamente para la mejora de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Achuapa is a beautiful and enchanting town located in the district of Leon, where there live many people who desire to get ahead.

José Leonel is called "el Joven," the Boy. He is 44 years old. He fights hard everyday for both himself and his family. He works in one of the local cities. He lives together with his wife and three children under his care. His wife works as a gradeschool teacher, and with the little that she makes is able to help her husband with the daily expenses of the household. 

One of José's dreams is to improve his home. For this reason he is requesting a loan through Kiva and CEPRODEL in order to purchase the cement, sand, and rebar the family needs to be able to improve their home. He is grateful to God that he found Kiva and CEPRODEL and so has the opportunity to apply for his fifth loan. He has been acquiring his home through the use of loans from Kiva and CEPRODEL, and so this one will go toward making improvements.

loans.use: purchase cement, sand, and rebar.

loans.name: Rouhiyeh

texts.en:
Rouhiyeh is 34 years old. She’s a Lebanese single woman. She’s very happy with her family, which includes one parent and two siblings. One of them is working. A few years ago, and after suffering from a bad financial situation, Rouhiyeh decided to help her mother to manage the household expenses.  So she opened a beauty and hair dressing salon in her town. She already has many years of experience in this domain, which makes her work professional and easier.

Today, she needs to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l.  She will use the loan to purchase new hair dressing tools and beauty supplies. In that way, she will be able to improve her work by trying new and trendy styles.  In the near future, she will have saved up the amount of money needed to have her own family and children.

loans.use: to purchase new hair dressing tools and beauty supplies

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man who has four children, all of whom attend school. He lives at a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water. He has operated a photography business for the past ten years, taking photographs at functions and in the neighborhood. He faces a major challenge of seasonality, especially when no functions are held and, hence, the business is slow. 

With the loan he is requesting, he wants to purchase a new photo machine for his business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase a new photo machine for his business.

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en: Angelique is 27 years old. She is married and has two children, aged two and three years. With the loan, she is planning to buy cooking oil to resell. The profits from the business will be used for expanding her business.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil to resell

loans.name: Anastasie

texts.en: Anastasie is 31 years old. She is married and has four children, aged between six months and nine years. She has requested a loan for buying more milk and sugar to resell. With the profits from the business, she will buy a cow, which will provide milk that she can sell without having to buy it.

loans.use: To buy more milk and sugar to resell

loans.name: Urtagy

texts.ru:
Уртажи 53  года, имеет 2 детей. Уртажи в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством, полеводством , стартовав этот бизнес 21 год назад с 20,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Уртажи, на данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется 3 коровы с приплодом,10 коз, 5 овец, ежемячный доход от продажи молочных подуктов составляет примерно 7,000 сом. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Уртажи обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку 1 дойной коровы.  Доходы от кредита Уртажи планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса.
texts.en: Urtagy is 53 years old and has 2 children.  She works with livestock and in agriculture as the sole source of income for her family, having started her business 21 years ago with 20,000 KGS.  Thanks to her hard work, Urtagy today owns 3 cows with offspring, 10 goats and 5 sheep.  Her monthly income from the sale of milk products is around 7,000 KGS.  With the goal of further developing her business, Urtagy turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 50,000 KGS to buy one dairy cow.  She plans to use the income for the loan to further invest in her business's expansion.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Qasim

texts.en:
Mr Qasim is a very hardworking, married man. He lives in Lahore, Pakistan. He is a father of one child. He always tries his best to fulfill the needs of his family. He has been running a garment shop in the area, which is the only source of income for the family.

Presently, he is interested in purchasing a variety of garments, including jeans, dress pants, shirts and t-shirts, to sell. However, due to the lack of financing, he finds it difficult. Therefore he has requested a loan amount of 150,000 PKR from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the profit, he will put aside some savings for the future. He is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase garments for the garment shop.

loans.name: Dorocas

texts.en:
Dorcas is 46 years old and comes from Nakuru. She practices farming and poultry-keeping. She has three children, aged 28, 26 and 24 years. 

Dorcas is a farmer and has been in a poultry-keeping business for the past four years. She has applied for her second loan from KADET LTD, after having repaid her previous loan successfully. She will use the loan to enable her to buy chickens, for later sale. She hopes to buy a plot of land and build rental houses, in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more chickens

loans.name: Alimkan

texts.ru:
Алимкан 50 лет, имеет 5 детей. Алимкан в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством, стартовав этот бизнес 20 лет назад с 18,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Алимкан, на данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется 2 коровы с приплодом, 30 овец, ежемесячный доход от продажи молочных продуктов составляет примерно 15,000 сом. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Алимкан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку  дойной коровы и мелкого рогатого скота.  Доходы от кредита Алимкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса.
texts.en:
Alimkan is 50 years old and has five children. As a main source of income for her family, she raises livestock and grows produce, having launched this business 20 years ago with a starting capital of 18,000 KGS. Thanks to Alimkan’s hard work, her farm at present includes two cows with their young and 30 sheep; the monthly revenue from dairy products’ sales is approximately 15,000 KGS.
In order to develop her business further, Alimkan applied to the “Bai Tushum & Partners” microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 100,000 KGS to purchase a dairy cow and small livestock. Alimkan plans to invest the resulting revenues into a further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Edinson

texts.es:
Edinson, de 36 años, es soltero y aun no tiene hijos, todo lo que genera es dedicado a sus padres con quienes vive hasta ahora a lado de su hermana, el dedica mucho de su vida para brindar lo mejor a su familia y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
Edinson se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles y otros productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, huevos, leche, detergentes, granos, alimentos balanceados y otros. Realiza este trabajo en un puesto de ventas ubicado en uno de los principales mercados de la ciudad. Lleva ya 2 años en esta actividad, al principio le fue un poco complicado empezar ya que no tenia ninguna experiencia en este negocio, pero con el tiempo aprendió y ahora tiene las pautas necesarias para tener contentos a su clientes.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es la continuidad de las ventas y la fluidez con la que llegan sus clientes a realizar diversas compras, además cuando tiene tiempo libre lo dedica a realizar otras funciones de recreación, le esta yendo bien en su negocio, tiene muchos clientes y esto le genera buenas ganancias económicas, espera seguir trabajando y hacer crecer su negocio .En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000 soles, agradece a todas las personas que le brindan la oportunidad de acceder al financiamiento que requiere para que continúe trabajando. Por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas.Con el monto solicitado comprará más productos para su tienda como arroz, aceite, leche y otros.
texts.en:
Edinson, 36, is single and still does not have any children. Everything he earns is dedicated to his parents with whom he lives together with his sister up until now. He dedicates much of his life to offer the best to his family, and thereby improving their quality of life.

Edinson makes a living selling foodstuffs, and other home staples products such as rice, sugar, eggs, milk, detergents, grains, balanced meals, and other things. He does this work in a sales stall located in one of the main city markets. He has two years experience in this field. At first it was complicated to begin for him since he did not have any experience with this business. But, with time, he learned and now he has the necessary guidelines to have his customers happy. 

What he likes about his job is the continuity of the sales and the fluidity that comes with his customers making diverse purchases. In addition, when he has free time, he does other recreational functions, his business is going well for him, he has many customers, and this generates a good income.

He hopes to continue working and grow his business. With this opportunity, he will be requesting 1000 soles. He thanks all of the people that give him the opportunity to access the financing he requires to be able to continue working. On the hand, he promises to complete the payments on time. With the amount requested, he will buy more products for his store like rice, oil, milk, and other things.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, and other things

loans.name: Villa Cumaravi Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VILLA CUMARAVI” iniciará el vigésimo noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por once  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Petrona es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de mantas de vicuña, venta de cosméticos, venta de ropa, artesanía en mantillas, venta de comidas, ayudante de albañil, venta de salchipapas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Petrona es integrante, ella indica que hace ocho años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de artesanía en tejido de mantas y mantillas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia, aprendiendo esta técnica de sus padres desde su infancia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana de alpaca) que adquirirá de las ferias tradicionales de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro, los servicios y el crédito.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Villa Cumaravi" is starting its 9th loan cycle with Pro Mujer, in their Senkata office.  This group has 11 members, and is led by a board of directors including Petrona, who is the president.  The members of this communal bank have a variety of businesses, including: weaving blankets from vicuña wool, selling cosmetics, selling clothing, making mantillas (traditional lace headpieces), selling food, selling fried potatoes and sausages, and working as a construction assistant. 

The loan that they are taking will benefit this group of small business-people, of which Petrona is a member.  She states that she's been a member of Pro Mujer for 8 years.  She joined at the invitation of a friend who is also a member.  At this time, Petrona has a handicraft business where she makes blankets and mantillas.  She started up this business on her own initiative, having learned to make these items from her parents when she was a child.

The loan that she is taking now will be used to increase her working capital (to buy alpaca wool from the traditional markets in the city of El Alto) so that she can later sell the finished goods in her retail space.  This work will enable her to generate resources to support her household as best she can, because she is single and has a child.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answered that she likes the savings accounts, the services, and the loans.

loans.use: to buy alpaca wool

loans.name: Manwa Group

texts.en:
Manwa is the featured borrower of Manwa's Group. She came along to apply for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua because the group members are friends and neighbors and trust each other a lot.

Manwa is a 48-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She has been working in handcrafts and souvenir making and sales since six years ago. She is a hard worker and talented in her domain. The loan being applied for will be invested in increasing her business capital to increase her handmade collection. She is the first from the right in the photo.

Houda is the first from the left. She is a 48-year-old married woman and a mother of three children who has been working as a tailor since two years ago. She is well known in her region with her special talent in her domain. Houda's requested loan will be invested in renewing her home's furniture to keep her customers and family pleased with what they have.

Rima is the second from the right. She is a 22-year-old single woman who has worked as a tutor since three years ago. The loan being applied for will be invested in paying for her wedding needs. She is so excited about it.

Roula is 29 years old and is employed in a hospital. The loan being applied for will be invested in paying school fees.

loans.use: to increase her business capital with special handmade products

loans.name: Sophie

texts.en: Sophie is 71 years old. She is a widow and has been left with one child aged 42. Sophie sells foodstuffs and has been running the business for five years. With the loan, she wants to buy more sorghum and bananas for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum and bananas for sale.

loans.name: Gloriose

texts.en: Gloriose is 32 years old. She sells various items in her business. With the loan, she would like to buy more lotions and hygienic papers for sale. The profits from the business will be used to generate more savings.

loans.use: To buy more lotions and hygenic papers for sale.

loans.name: Hilario Antonio

texts.es:
Achuapa un bello Municipio ubicado en el departamento de León, donde existen muchas personas emprendedoras, con espíritu de superación.

Hilario Antonio se llama el Joven de 44 años edad Luchador por su vida y la de su familia, brinda su servicio como colector de basura. 

Vive con su esposa y tres hijos bajo su cargo, ella trabaja como ama de casa, con lo poco que el gana, a duras pena cubre el sustento diario de su hogar, pero son de sus sueños mejorar su vivienda, por tal razón solicita a Kiva Y Ceprodel que le financie un crédito para la compra de: Cemento, Arena, Zin con esto ayudaría mucho a su familia en poder mejorar su viviendita. 

Agradece a Dios Por Primer Instancia porque fue quien le ilumino de haber solicitado su primer crédito con ceprodel para este tipo de mejora a realizar en su vivienda y espera obtener de parte de Kiva Una Respuesta Positiva de su Parte.
texts.en:
Achuapa is a beautiful town located in the district of Leon, where many industrious people live with a spirit of self-improvement. 

Hilario Antonio is this young man's name. He is 44 years old and fights hard every day for himself and his family working as a trash collector. 

He lives together with his wife and three children under his care. She works as a house wife. With the little money that he makes it is sometimes difficult to cover the daily household expenses, but his greatest dream is make improvements on his home. For this reason he is requesting a loan through Kiva and CEPRODEL that will allow him to purchase cement, sand, and metal sheeting which will help his family a great deal in making improvements to their little home. 

He is grateful to God first and foremost because He showed Hilario the way to apply for his first loan with CEPRODEL and thus make his first improvements to his home. He hopes that Kiva will give a positive response on his behalf.

loans.use: purchase cement, sand, and metal sheeting.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth, de 42 años de edad , es divorciada y tiene 3 hijas, por ello educa sola a sus hijas y  busca darles una buena educación.El trabajo de Ruth consiste en la venta de abarrotes en general como arroz, aceite, fréjoles, azúcar, golosinas entre otros. Esta actividad la realiza  en un local que esta en el interior de su propia  vivienda. Se inicio en esta labor para ayudar con los gastos del mantenimiento de su familia, con el tiempo consolido su bodega . Lleva 4 años en este trabajo. Considera rentable su  negocio porqué se encuentra  ubicada en una avenida transitable durante todo el día y también  por los distintos productos que tiene. Ahora solo espera mantener su negocio y seguir atendiendo con normalidad a sus clientes.Por tanto este será su préstamo número 4 con Kiva, está muy emocionada al saber que tendrá un respaldo económico para poder seguir con su actividad económica, se compromete a ser una socia muy cumplida y realizar sus pagos siempre a tiempo. 
Con el monto solicitado de 300 soles, comprará azúcar, arroz, papel higiénico y otros para su venta.
texts.en:
Ruth, 42, is divorced and has 3 daughters.  For this reason, she alone must educate her children and seek to provide them with a good education.  Ruth has a business selling groceries, including: rice, cooking oil, beans, sugar, snacks, and other items.  She does this work from a store that is set up in her home.  She started doing this work to help pay for her family's expenses, and over time she built her store.  She has 4 years of experience with the business.  She considers it to be profitable because she is located on a road where people pass through all day long, and also because of the different products that she carries.  Now she only wants to keep the business going and continue to serve her customers as usual.    This will be her 4th loan with Kiva, and she is very excited to know that she will have the financial backing to continue with her business.  She promises to be a conscientious member of her group who will always make her payments on time.

With the sum of 300 Peruvian soles that she requests, she will buy sugar, rice, toilet paper, and other items to sell.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, toilet paper, and other items for her store

loans.name: Jelder Noe

texts.es:
El joven Jelder Noé es un ebanista y soltero que reside en la ciudad de Condega, ubicada a unos 35 km al norte de la cabecera departamental de Estelí. El comparte la misma casa de habitación junto a sus otras hermanas y su tío.

Este joven trabaja a diario en una fabrica de artesanía donde se hacen todos tipos de artesanías a base de madera, esta fabrica esta ubicada a unos 4 km al sur del municipio de Condega, el viaja diario de lunes a viernes desde las 7 am hasta las 5 pm a trabajar y donde sus ingresos esta estipulados a base de la producción que el a diario saque. El tienes unos 6 años de laborar en esta empresa la cuales es su única fuente de ingreso de donde costea sus gastos familiares y universitarios.

El joven Jelder Noé se presento a las oficinas de Ceprodel a realizar una solitud de crédito para poder costear sus gastos universitarios como son los materiales que utiliza así como el pago de los aranceles. Cabe mencionar que este cliente en ocasiones anteriores a tenido ya cinco ciclos crediticios varios de ellos para costear su universidad y se a mostrado mas que agradecido ya que gracias a ellos el ha ido avanzando en sus clases universitarias y su beneficio a sido positivo. El espera que le logren a aprobar esta nueva solicitud y así poder seguir avanzando en sus estudios y algún día lograr ser un profesional.
texts.en:
Young Jelder Noé is a carpenter and a bachelor who resides in the city of Condega, located 35 km north of the district capital of Estelí. He shares a house together with his sisters and an uncle.

This young man works each day in a artisan factory where he makes all kinds of handicrafts with wood. This factory is located about 4 km south of the town of Conedga. He travels there each day at 7:00 AM and works until 5:00 PM. His wages are based on his daily production. He has worked for this company for about 6 years and it is his sole source of income for paying his daily expenses and university tuition.

Jelder Noé came to the offices of CEPRODEL to complete an application for a loan in order to cover the his university expenses such as the materials that he uses and his tuition costs. It bears mentioning that this client has been through five loan cycles on previous occasions, some of which also covered the cost of his education. He has shown himself to be more than grateful because thanks to these loans he has been able to continue with this university classes and the results have all been positive. He hopes that he will be approved for this new loan and thus be able to continue advancing in his studies and one day achieve his goal of being a professional.

loans.use: pay university tuition.

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es:
Condega  un municipio que está ubicado en la parte norte del departamento de Estelí, conocido como tierra de alfareros por su artesanía y gente trabajadora. Vive el señor concepción  en una comunidad aledaña, con su esposa y 3 hijos al que tiene el deber de mantener y darles sus estudios, de profesión, agricultor en granos básicos y la ganadería en una pequeña escala.

Conocido como una persona honesta y trabajadora tiene una propiedad de 24 manzanas de extensión con diferentes tipos de aéreas para la explotación agrícola y ganadera.

Recientemente  visitó las oficinas y está solicitando un crédito para compra de abono, herbicida y fungicida  más  mano de obra, donde piensa salir beneficiado y darle el mantenimiento correspondiente  a sus cultivos maíz y frijoles. 

El lleva 10 créditos para este tipo de actividad, tiene 8 años de trabajar con Ceprodel. El impacto y beneficios que tiene el y su familia es de una forma positiva ya que trabajan  su finca a través de siembras agrícolas en cada ciclo,  mejorando su nivel de vida y condiciones económicas con los ingresos obtenidos en cada cosecha realizada.
texts.en:
Condega is a municipality that is located in the northern part of the administrative division of Estelí, known as the "land of potters" for its craft work and hard-working people. Concepción lives in a surrounding community with his wife and three children, who he is obligated to support and give an education to. Professionally, he is a basic grain farmer and works with livestock on a small scale.

He is known as an honest and hard-working person. He has a property that extends 42 acres, with different types of areas for agricultural and livestock exploitation.

Recently, he visited the Ceprodel office and is requesting a loan for the purchase of fertilizer, herbicide and fungicide as well as more labor, to be used where he thinks it will be beneficial and appropriately maintain his corn and bean crops.

He has taken out ten loans for this type of activity, having worked with Ceprodel for eight years. The impact and benefits that they have had for him and his family have been positive. Since they work on their farm sowing crops during each cycle, they have improved their standard of living and economic conditions with the income obtained when each harvest is carried out.

loans.use: to buy supplies (fertilizer, herbicide and fungicide)

loans.name: Zakaria

texts.en:
Zakaria is a married man and has two kids who attend school. His wife is a businesswoman and together they live in a rental house that has neither  electricity nor piped water. 

Zakaria has operated a tailoring business for the past six years. His potential clients are ladies and gentlemen. He dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. 

With this loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings (KES), he wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for his business. He decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for his business.

loans.name: Francine

texts.en: Francine is 42 years old. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for the period of seven years. She is married and has three children, and all the children go to school. She wants to use this loan to buy more cooking oil, corn flour, and sugar to resell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil, corn flour, and sugar to resell

loans.name: Costasie

texts.en: Costasie is 47 years old. She sells fish and has been in the business for four years. With the loan, she wants to buy more tomatoes, rice and cooking oil. The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes, rice, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Meteoritos 2 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “METEORITOS 2” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por seis  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Verónica es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: costura de mandiles, tejido y venta de mantas, venta de papas fritas y galletas, trenzado de mantas, venta de fruta, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Verónica es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de frutas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia con un poco capital que en la actualidad desea ampliar.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de fruta) que adquirirá de las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro.
texts.en:
The communal bank “METEORITOS 2” (Meteorites 2) will begin its first loan cycle in Pro Mujer as a part of the Focal Center of Senkata. It is made up of six members and is directed by a board, of which Verónica is the president. 

The businesses that the members of the communal bank have are various. Among them are: sewing aprons, knitting and sales of blankets, french fry and cracker sales, rug braiding, fruit sales, and food sales. 

The loan they are getting out will benefit a group of small microentrepreneurs of which Verónica is a member. She states that this is the first time she has joined Pro Mujer, signing up at the invitation of a friend who is a partner of the institution. Currently, she has a business selling fruit. She began this business on her own initiative with little capital, and she currently wishes to expand it.

The loan that she will take out is for a capital increase for fruit purchase. She will acquire the fruit in the fairs in the city of El Alto and will subsequently sell it in her retail space. This way of working allows her to generate resources in order to support her home as much as possible since she has a common law husband and two children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the savings.

loans.use: to buy fruit

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Ms Fozia is a 40-year-old married woman. She has had a business of a beauty parlor for seven years. She offers many facilities to her customers, such as makeup, hair styling, and facials. Because of the services she provides, she has become very famous in her street. 

In order to meet with the increasing demands of her customers, Fozia is interested in buying more variety of cosmetics products for her parlor.  But because of having low cash in hand, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 30,000 Pakistan rupees (PKR) to buy hair care products, skin products, and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities. She hopes to cater to more customers time after time and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products, and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase his own motorcycle

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Achuapa un bello Municipio ubicado en el departamento de León, donde existen muchas personas emprendedoras, con espíritu de superación.

Juan se llama este Joven de 66 años edad Luchador por su vida y la de su familia, brinda su servicio como colector de basura en el municipio. 

Vive con su esposa y un hijo bajo su cargo, ella trabaja como ama de casa, con lo poco que el gana, a duras pena cubre el sustento diario de su hogar, pero es de su necesidad mejorar las condiciones de su salud para seguir rindiendo en su trabajo y llevarle el sustento diario a su hogar por tal razón le solicita a Kiva Y Ceprodel que le financie un crédito para la compra de medicamento para el mejorar el bien de su salud. 

Agradece a Dios Por Primer Instancia porque fue quien le ilumino de haber solicitado su primer crédito a kiva y ceprodel para la mejora de su salud ya que estos financian este tipo de actividad siendo para él la más importante de su vida.
texts.en: Achuapa is a beautiful town located in Leon department. There are many enterprising people there who want to move forward. Juan, 66, struggles for his life and for his family's life. He works as a trash collector in his city. He lives with his wife and his son. She cares for the home. With the little he earns, they barely meet the household's daily needs. He needs to improve his health to keep doing his job and bring home the daily bread. This is why he is asking for a loan from Kiva and Ceprodel to buy medicine to improve his health. He is grateful to God first of all for enlightening him to apply for his first loan from Kiva and Ceprodel to improve his health, since they finance this kind of activity, being the most important part of his life.

loans.use: to buy medicine.

loans.name: Basilio De Jesús

texts.es:
Condega un municipio conocido como tierra de alfareros por su artesanía y gente trabajadora, vive el señor Basilio en una comunidad aledaña con su esposa y 2 hijos al que tiene el deber de mantener y darles sus estudios , de profesión, agricultor, en granos básicos maíz y frijoles y la ganadería en pequeña escala.

Don Basilio conocido como una persona honesta y trabajadora, tiene más de 15 años de experiencia y trabajar estos rubros, trabaja junto con su familia en su finca de diez manzanas  que es alta mente productiva y quiere sacarle un buen provecho explotándola en uno de los mejores rubros de la zona como es el cultivo de maíz y frijoles, hoy en día  nos está solicitando un crédito, para la compra de de abono, insecticida, fungicida más gastos de mano de obra.
 
Su proyección es cultivar tres manzanas de frijol y comercializarlos una vez que los coseche obteniendo un buen ingreso para cancelar y cubrir los gastos de su familia lo que le permitirá seguir trabajando en los nuevos ciclos agrícolas  y mejorar el nivel de vida cada día de su familia ya que es su única forma de obtener ingresos.
texts.en:
Condega is a city known as the land of potters for its craftsmanship and hardworking people. Basilio lives in an adjacent community with his wife and two children. He must take care of his children and make sure they receive an education. He works in agriculture as a farmer of basic grains such as corn and beans, and he also has a few livestock. 

Basilio is known as an honest and hardworking person. He has 15 years experience working in this field, and he works with his family on their farm, which is approximately 17 acres. The farm is extremely productive and he wants to expand it into becoming one of the best businesses in the area for corn and bean cultivation. Currently, he is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, insecticide, fungicide and labor.

His future plan is to cultivate more acres of beans and sell them once they are harvested to make a profit. This will allow him to repay his loan and cover his family's expenses. This will allow him to keep working on new farming cycles, and to improve his family's quality of life since this is his only way of earning income.

loans.use: to buy supplies (fertilizer, insecticide, fungicide, and labor)

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Ms Razia is a 37-year-old married woman and mother of five children. She had a difficult time after her husband's business failure and decided to initiate her own business to support her family for a better future.

Razia makes beautiful embroidery patterns with sequins and beads for the people of her community and makes a reasonable amount of income. However, due to the lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 20,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR). Razia intends to use this loan amount to buy raw material including cloth and threads in different colors, along with packs of sequins, pearls, and stones for embellishment. This will help her to meet her customers’ demands without fail. She dreams of providing quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials including cloth and threads in different colors, along with packs of sequins, pearls, and stones for embellishment.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en: Helena is 40 years old. She sells potatoes and has been selling these items for one year. With the loan, she wants to buy more potatoes to sell.  The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes to sell

loans.name: Clemantine

texts.en: Clemantine is 41 years old. She sells different items in her business. She wants the loan to add more items such as rice, maize flour and wheat flour to sell.  The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business. She is very happy for the previous loan.

loans.use: to buy more rice, maize flour and wheat flour to sell

loans.name: Mark

texts.en: Mark is a 30-year-old single man. He describes himself to be innovative. He operates a retail shop where he sells milk, sugar, rice and other items. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in an urban area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to to add stock to his inventory of milk, sugar, rice and other items to sell in his retail store. His business goal is to have a supermarket within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stock to his inventory of milk, sugar, rice and other items to sell in his retail store

loans.name: Ume

texts.en:
Ms. Ume is a 41-year-old married woman who has had a business of selling milk for the past 12 years. She has one buffalo and sells its milk to many of her neighbors. Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life. She has three children, one of whom is in school.

Ume is very motivated to provide her children with good education, food, and clothing. She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. It’s her first year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through support of it.

She requested a loan of 25,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR) to purchase another buffalo. She hopes to increase her production capacity of milk, which will ultimately help in generating more cash. She dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Hina

texts.en:
Ms. Hina is a 23-year-old single woman. A year ago she started a small general store at the corner of the house. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. Her father is a laborer and her brother is employed in a rice mill, but their income is not enough to meet the daily expenses of the family members. She is working hard to contribute to the family income.

For the improvement of her business, Hina contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for her second loan of 30,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR). She intends to use this loan amount to purchase packs of tissue papers, soaps, and lotions. She then will be able to consistently meet the increasing demand. She wishes to use part of the revenue to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to purchase packs of tissue papers, soaps, and lotions.

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is a 41-year-old married man. He has 7 children with ages ranging from 10 to 20 years. He has been involved in the livestock business for 3 years. His business is located a rural area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be climatic changes and diseases. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy livestock. He is employed as a security guard in a secondary school.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en: Eugenie age 33, is a mother of four children. They all go to school. She sells various items, including both food and general items. With the loan, she wants to add more soaps, corn flour and salts to sell. The profits from the business will be used to increase the volume of sales.

loans.use: to buy more soaps, corn flour and salt to sell

loans.name: Purity

texts.en: Purity is a 34-year-old married woman. She has 6 children with ages ranging from 6 months to 10 years. She operates a charcoal business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in an urban area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of enough capital. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to to buy more charcoal to sell. Her business goal is to be stable within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a 38-year-old married woman. She has 7 children with ages ranging from 2 years to 19 years. She operates a charcoal business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in an urban area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of enough capital. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to to buy more charcoal to sell. Her business goal is to be stable within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en: Stanley is a 37-year-old married man. He has 5 children with ages ranging from 1 year to 12 years. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a clothes shop where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in an urban area. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to to buy more clothes to sell. His business goal is to open a big store within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Nazura

texts.ru:
Назуре 41 год, имеет 4 детей. Назура работает в школе и в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством, полеводством , стартовав этот бизнес 8 лет назад с 12,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Назуры, на данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется 2 коровы с приплодом, 1 лошадь, ежемесячный доход от продажи молочных продуктов составляет примерно 10,000 сом. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Назура обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 85,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку  дойной коровы и мелкого рогатого скота.  Доходы от кредита Назура планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса и хотела бы накопить средства на обучение детей.
texts.en: Nazura is 41 years old and has four children. She works in a school, and also farms to provide an additional source of income for her family. She began her work raising animals and growing crops 8 years ago with 12,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her tireless work, Nazura now has two cows and their offspring, a horse, and a monthly income of 10,000 som from selling milk products. In order to further develop her business, Nazura came to the microfinance group Bai-Tushum and Partners for a 85,000 som (KGS) loan to buy a milk cow and small livestock. She plans to invest the revenue from use of the loan into the further expansion of her business. She also wants to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Linet

texts.en: Linet is a 34-year-old married woman. She has 2 children ages 3 years and 1 year. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a maize roasting business where she roasts green maize and sells it.  She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in an urban area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of capital. She will use the 10,000 KES loan to buy more maize for roasting to sell. Her business goal is to own a big maize store within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more maize for roasting to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a beauty salon where she sells hair products and also does hair treatments and plaiting. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in an urban area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of capital. She will use the 40,000 KES loan to expand her salon business by buying more hair products. Her business goal is to own a big salon within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to expand her salon business by buying more hair products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to finish the interior of his home.

loans.name: Holniso

texts.ru: Холнисо жизнерадостная, позитивная женщина, а также заботливая жена и мама двоих детей.  Ещё учась в школе, она отличалась от других девушек своей предприимчивостью и стремлением достигать поставленные ею цели.   После окончания школы она не смогла поступить в высшее учебное заведение, так как родители решили выдать её замуж. Сначала Холнисо жила на обеспечении мужа, но когда появились дети, то дохода мужа не стало хватать на достойное проживание. И тогда она решила начать свой малый бизнес.   Она арендовала магазин в центре вещевого рынка и стала привозить из других стран женскую одежду и продавать среди местного населения.   И вот сегодня, уже как 13 лет, она занимается этим видом бизнеса.   Она обрела много постоянных покупателей, и все они имеют хорошее мнение о Холнисо, как о порядочной и ответственной женщине.   Этот бизнес приносит ей хорошую прибыль, и эти деньги она расходует на образование своих детей.   Также дополнительный доход для своей семьи Холнисо имеет от мужа, который работает разнорабочим в России.   Он ежемесячно присылает ей заработанные денежные средства. Сейчас Холниссо хочет сделать большой закуп летней одежды, в связи с сезонностью, это поможет ей увеличить её товарооборот.   Поэтому Холнисо обратилась в Арванд и желает получить кредит для покупки женской летней одежды для дальнейшей продажи.   Она заранее благодарит Арванд за оказанную поддержку.
texts.en: Holniso is a joyful, optimistic woman, and a caring wife and mother to two children. She stood out from her peers even in school for her enterprising nature and drive to achieve her goals. After finishing high school she was unable to enroll in a university because her parents decided to marry her off. At first Holniso lived off of her husband, but when children came her husband's income became insufficient for the family. She decided to start her own business, by renting a store in the center of the clothing market and importing women's clothing to sell. Today, 13 years later, she is still in the business. She has won many loyal customers who consider her an organized and responsible woman. The business has earned her a good income, which she spends on her children's education. Her husband works as a laborer in Russia and sends money home each month. Now Holniso wants to make a large purchase of summer clothing to match the season and improve her sales. To do that, Holniso came to Arvand for a loan to buy summer clothing for future sale. She thanks you for your support in advance.

loans.use: to buy summer season women's clothing

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a 28-year-old married man. He has 4 children with ages ranging from 2 years to 8 years. He describes himself to be committed. He operates a business for selling stones where he sells stones for building houses. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a rural area and his primary customers are construction firms. He describes his biggest business challenge to be transport. He will use the 15,000 KES loan to buy more building stones to sell. His business goal is to be stable within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more building stones to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry feed

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas is a 55-year-old married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 28 to 36 years. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a clothing retail store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. Her business is located in an urban area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of enough capital. She will use the 30,000 KES loan to to buy more clothes to sell. Her business goal is to have a bigger shop and add more products within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan was paid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 53-year-old married woman. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail store where she sells potatoes, arrow roots and bananas. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in an urban area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of enough capital. She will use the 30,000 KES loan to to buy more potatoes, arrow roots and bananas to sell. Her business goal is to build a kiosk within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan was paid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes, arrow roots and bananas to sell

loans.name: Elenor

texts.en: Elenor is 42 years old and lives in Paynesville South which is one of the populate areas in Montserrado County.  She is married.  For the past 5 years she has been selling biscuits, fresh milk, candy, rice, pepper, charcoal, and oil in the local market.  She makes a profit sometimes, but most of the time business is slow. She is requesting a loan to purchase more biscuits, fresh milk, candy, rice, pepper, charcoal, and oil for her business. Her plans are to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more biscuits, fresh milk, candy, rice, pepper, charcoal, and oil for her business

loans.name: Esmeralda De San Antonio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESMERALDA DE SAN ANTONIO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por seis  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Amalia es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de frutas, venta de comida, Atención de tienda de barrio, costura de polleras, venta de refrescos, tejido de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Amalia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de cosméticos; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por cuenta propia aprendiendo el negocio de su amiga.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cosméticos) que adquirirá de las distribuidoras por mayor y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en: The "Esmeralda de San Antonio" group will be starting its first loan cycle with Kiva partner Pro Mujer out of the Alto Lima office. This group consists of six members and has a board of directors with Amalia as secretary. The members' businesses are varied and include selling fruit, selling food, running a neighborhood store, sewing skirts, selling refreshments and weaving blankets. The loan will help these small businesses, including Amalia's. This is her first experience with Pro Mujer, joining after one of the institution's promoters invited her after visiting her home. Amalia currently has a business selling cosmetics, which she started on her own after learning the trade from her friend. She plans to use the loan to increase her capital to purchase cosmetics from wholesale distributors, and she will then sell the products from her sales space. In this way she will generate revenue to provide for her household as much as possible, since she is a single mother with one son. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Amalia said she likes the health center.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 53-year-old married man. He has 6 children with ages ranging from 15 years to 32 years. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a farm where he grows crops and vegetables to sell. He has been involved in this business for 30 years. His business is located in a rural area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of enough capital. He will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy seeds, feed, fertilizers and other items to boost his farming business.  His business goal is to be a supplier within 5 years. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loans were paid successfully.

loans.use: to buy feed, seeds, fertilizers and other items to boost his farming business

loans.name: Artan

texts.en:
Artan is a 34-year-old married Egyptian Albanian and has two children.  Artan has been operating his pig farming business with the help of his father for the past four years in the rural area of a major city where he and his family reside. “I just love what I do. With the climate in our region being cool in the summer, pigs won’t need any access to a wallow. They have a limited tolerance to high temperatures and heat stress which can lead them to death. Thus, my friendly animal nature combined with the proper climate, have made it possible for me to have success with this activity. And of course, with my father’s help as well,” Artan said smiling.

He needs Kiva lenders’ help to build a stable for his pigs and he remains positive that they will help him financially.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a stable for the pigs

loans.name: Emerson Alexis
