texts.es: Emerson es un hombre muy responsable y trabajador vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, Emerson trabaja en su propio taller electrónico en el que se dedica a reparar televisores, ventiladores, radios, control remotos para televisores y equipos de sonidos, entre otros aparatos, él ya cuenta con más de dos años de poseer ente negocio en el centro del departamento en que reside y cuenta con muchos clientes quienes lo prefieren por ser amable y honrado. Emerson solicita un credito por medio del cual pueda comprar diferentes repuestos como integrados, chips, cables, y otros más para reparar mayor cantidad de electrodomésticos y asi obtener mejores ganancias para darle una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en: Emerson is a very responsible and hardworking man who lives in his own home with his wife and two children. He works at his own electronics shop where he repairs televisions, fans, radios, remote controls, sound equipment and other items. He has had the business for more than two years in the center of the department where he lives and has many customers who favor him for his friendliness and honesty. Emerson is requesting the loan so he can purchase different parts like integrated circuits, chips, cables and other supplies to repair a larger amount of appliances and thus earn more income to provide his family a better life.

loans.use: to purchase parts to fix appliances.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.ru:
Владимир занимается выращиванием овощей в теплицах на своем участке с В-Знаменка уже 18 лет. Основные культуры - помидоры, огурцы, редис. 

Шесть лет Владимир работал в Киеве крановщиком. В отпуске и на выходные приезжал и трудился на огороде у себя дома. Работы в Киеве не стало и Владимир решил занятся сельски  хозяйством - как основным источником дохода. Теперь Владимир уделяет больше времени детям и своим теплицам.

У Владимира много земли, поэтому он хочет построить еще одну теплицу осенью. Кредит понадобился для приобретения удобрений (3000 гривен), пленки (2500 гривен), семян (5000 гривен), мотоблок для вспашки (4500 грн)
texts.en:
Vladimir has been growing vegetables in greenhouses on his plot in Velikaya Znamenka for 18 years. His primary crops are tomatoes, cucumbers, and radishes. 

Vladimir worked in Kiev for six years as a crane operator. On vacations and days off he would go home and work in the garden. The job didn't last and Vladimir decided to farm full time. Now he has more time for his children and greenhouses. 

Vladimir has extra land, so he wants to build a new greenhouse in the fall. He needs a loan for fertilizer (3000 Hryvnia), plastic sheeting (2500 Hryvnia), seeds (5000 Hryvnia), and a rototiller for tillage (4500 Hryvnia).

loans.use: buy fertilizer, seeds, sheeting, and small machinery for his greenhouse.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru: Наталья занимается шитьем на заказ. Она уже пользовалась микрокредитами раньше и считает их очень удобными и полезными для бизнеса. Наталья просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 24000 гривен на закупку новых тканей перед выпускными балами. Она уже имеет несколько заказов и планирует купить необходимый материал благодаря кредиту. Она надеется увеличить свой доход и улучшить жилищные условия своей семьи.
texts.en: Natalya is a seamstress, who sews special orders. She has already used micro loans, and considers them very helpful for her business. She is asking for a loan of 24000 Hryvnia, to buy new fabric before the senior proms. She already has a few orders and plans to buy the necessary material using the loan. Se hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: buy material for sewing dresses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed and cows to boost her dairy business.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is 46 years old. She lives in Kutaisi district, West Georgia with her 49 year old husband, 20 year old son and daughter in-law.  Nana requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, without any success. Her loan request was rejected every time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Nana’s husband is an artisan. He works on house renovations for private orders and earns a small monthly income. This is the only source of living for the family, which is rarely enough to cover their monthly expenses. 

Nana requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Nana has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With her credit Nana will purchase calves. She wants to raise them and in the future sell them at a good price at the local markets. Nana’s new business will bring her a good profit. Part of the profit she will reinvest in the same field, in order to develop her farming and another part she will use for improving the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Remmy

texts.en: Remmy is 28 years old. He is married and they have one child. He sells clothes and has been in the business for the past three years. He wants to buy more clothes to sell. The profits from the business will be used for savings.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Mediatrice

texts.en: Mediatrice is 38 years old. She is married and has five children. With the loan, she will buy more utensils such as saucepans, flasks and cups to sell. She is planning to use the profits to provide food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more utensils to sell

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is a married woman.  She has four children, all of whom attend school. Farida owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Farida has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other firewood operators in the business.
 
With the 45,000 KES she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.ru:
Людмила замужем. У нее есть взрослые дети. Она имеет свой бизнес.

Людмила занимается тепличным хозяйством на протяжении 15 лет. Она выращивает ранние и поздние овощи.  Наиболее продаваемыми являются огурцы, помидоры и картофель. Людмила ответственная и трудолюбивая. Хочет развивать бизнес и увеличивать доход семьи.

Людмила просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 15000 гривен на подготовку к сезону теплиц.  Ей нужно закупить удобрения, дрова, семена на вторую посадку и шланги для капельного полива.
texts.en:
Ludmila is married and has adult children. She runs her own business. 

Ludmila has been growing early and late season vegetables in greenhouses for the past 15 years. The most popular are cucumbers, tomatoes, and potatoes. She is a responsible and hard working person, and she wants to expand her business and improve her family's income. 

Ludmila is asking for a 15000 Hryvnia loan to prepare for the greenhouse season. She needs to buy fertilizer, firewood, seeds for a second planting, and hose for drip irrigation.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer, firewood, seeds, and irrigation hose

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 57-year-old single woman. She has 6 children with ages ranging from 20 years to 35 years. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail shop in which she sells water, drinks, sweets, and other items. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in an urban area. She says her biggest business challenge is lack of enough capital. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to to buy more drinks for stocking her retail shop. Her business goal is to be a supplier within 5 years. This is her fifth loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were paid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more drinks to stock her retail shop.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, age 23, operates a motorcycle providing transportation services. He has been involved in this business for four years. He describes himself as a focused, visionary and determined man. His business is located in a residential area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insecurity within the area. David is not yet married.

He is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 KES to supplement money he has saved in order to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to own two more motorcycles within five years. He hopes someday to get married and have children, and he wants to be able to offer them a quality education.
 
This is his second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle for his motorcycle transport business

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en: Eugenie is 40 years old. She sells used clothes and has been in the business for fifteen years. With the loan, she wants to buy more used clothes and the profits from the business are expected to be used as a source of savings.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is a married woman but has no children. She lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a cereal shop business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Dorothy dreams of establishing a wholesale cereal shop business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of 60,000 KES, she wants to purchase inventory of wheat flour, maize flour, and beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase inventory of wheat flour, maize flour, and beans
